bh

bhakāra

masc. adding the syllable -bha to a name; considered derogatory [bha + kāra] ~

Grammar masc, comp, derog
Meaning adding the syllable -bha to a name; considered derogatory
Construction bha + kāra
Commentary (VINa) yakārena vā bhakārena vā'ti yakārabhakāre yojetvā yo akkoso.
bhakuṭi

fem. frown; scowl; black look; lit. brow curve [bhā + kuṭi] ✓

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning frown; scowl; black look; lit. brow curve
Construction bhā + kuṭi
Compound kammadhāraya (bhā + kuṭi)
Variant bhākuṭi, bhūkuṭi
Sanskrit bhṛkuṭi

atha kho, bhikkhave, vedehikā gahapatānī kāḷiṃ dāsiṃ etadavoca, he je kāḷī'ti. kiṃ, ayye'ti? kiṃ, je, divā uṭṭhāsī'ti? na khv'ayye, kiñcī'ti. no vata re kiñci, pāpi dāsi, divā uṭṭhāsī'ti kupitā anattamanā bhakuṭiṃ akāsi.

MN 21 kakacūpamasuttaṃ
bhakkha 1

adj. eating; feeding on; feasting on [√bhakkh + a] ✓

Grammar adj, in comps, from bhakkhati
Meaning eating; feeding on; feasting on
Root Family √bhakkh
Root √bhakkh･1 a (eat)
Construction √bhakkh + a
Derivative kita (a)
Sanskrit bhakṣa
Sanskrit Root √bhakṣ 1 (partake of, eat)

saññā nu kho, bhante, purisassa attā, udāhu aññā saññā añño attā'ti? kaṃ pana tvaṃ, poṭṭhapāda, attānaṃ paccesī'ti? oḷārikaṃ kho ahaṃ, bhante, attānaṃ paccemi rūpiṃ cātumahābhūtikaṃ kabaḷīkār'āhārabhakkhan'ti.

DN 9.4 poṭṭhapādasuttaṃ, saññāattakathā

susukhaṃ vata jīvāma,
yesaṃ no n'atthi kiñcanaṃ,
pītibhakkhā bhavissāma,
devā ābhassarā yathā.

DHP 200 sukhavaggo

bhagandalā

fem. fistula [bhagaṃ + dala + ā] ✓

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning fistula
Construction bhagaṃ + dala + ā
bhagandala + ā
Derivative taddhita (ā)
Commentary (NIDD1a) bhagaṃ dālayatī'ti bhagandalā, vaccamaggaṃ phāletī'ti attho.
Sanskrit bhagaṃdara

iti imasmiṃ kāye vividhā ābādhā uppajjanti, seyyath'idaṃ ... pakkhandikā sūlā visūcikā kuṭṭhaṃ gaṇḍo kilāso soso apamāro daddu kaṇḍu kacchu nakhasā vitacchikā lohitaṃ pittaṃ madhumeho aṃsā piḷakā bhagandalā

bhagavatā

masc. by the Buddha [√bhaj + a + vant + ā] ✓

Grammar masc, instr sg of bhagavant
Meaning by the Buddha
Root Family √bhaj
Root √bhaj･1 a (divide, distribute)
Construction √bhaj > bhag + a + vant + ā
bhagavant + ā
Phonetic Change j > g
Sanskrit bhagavatā
Sanskrit Root √bhaj 1 (divide, share)

dhamme aveccappasādena samannāgato hoti, svākkhāto bhagavatā dhammo sandiṭṭhiko akāliko ehipassiko opaneyyiko paccattaṃ veditabbo viññūhī'ti

DN 16.11 mahāparinibbānasuttaṃ

seyyathā'pi, bhante, nikkujjitaṃ vā ukkujjeyya, paṭicchannaṃ vā vivareyya, mūḷhassa vā maggaṃ ācikkheyya, andhakāre vā telapajjotaṃ dhāreyya, cakkhumanto rūpāni dakkhantī'ti. evam'evaṃ bhagavatā anekapariyāyena dhammo pakāsito.

DN 14.13 mahāpadānasuttaṃ
bhagavati

masc. under the Sublime One, Blessed One, Fortunate One, Buddha [√bhaj] ✗
bhagavato 1

masc. to the Buddha; for the Buddha [√bhaj + a + vant + to] ✓

Grammar masc, dat sg of bhagavant
Meaning to the Buddha; for the Buddha
Root Family √bhaj
Root √bhaj･1 a (divide, distribute)
Construction √bhaj > bhag + a + vant + to
bhagavant + to
Phonetic Change j > g
Sanskrit bhagavate
Sanskrit Root √bhaj 1 (divide, share)

ekam'antaṃ nisinnā kho therā bhikkhū yāvatako ahosi sabbeh'eva saddhiṃ kathāsallāpo, taṃ sabbaṃ bhagavato ārocesuṃ.

AN 6.61 majjhesuttaṃ

atha kho kasibhāradvājo brāhmaṇo mahatiyā kaṃsapātiyā pāyāsaṃ vaḍḍhetvā bhagavato upanāmesi, bhuñjatu bhavaṃ gotamo pāyasaṃ.

SNP 4 kasibhāradvājasuttaṃ
uragavaggo 4
bhagavato 2

masc. of the Buddha [√bhaj + a + vant + to] ✓

Grammar masc, gen sg of bhagavant
Meaning of the Buddha
Root Family √bhaj
Root √bhaj･1 a (divide, distribute)
Construction √bhaj > bhag + a + vant + to
bhagavant + to
Phonetic Change j > g
Sanskrit bhagavataḥ
Sanskrit Root √bhaj 1 (divide, share)

ehi tvaṃ, tāta sudassana, bhagavato santike imaṃ gāthaṃ pariyāpuṇitvā mama bhatt'ābhihāre bhāsa. ahañ'ca te devasikaṃ kahāpaṇasataṃ bhikkhaṃ pavattayissāmī'ti.

SN 3.13 doṇapākasuttaṃ

idam'avoca bhagavā. attamanā te bhikkhū bhagavato bhāsitaṃ abhinandun'ti.

MN 40 cūḷāssapurasuttaṃ
bhagavato 3

masc. from the Buddha [√bhaj + a + vant + to] ✓

Grammar masc, abl sg of bhagavant
Meaning from the Buddha
Root Family √bhaj
Root √bhaj･1 a (divide, distribute)
Construction √bhaj > bhag + a + vant + to
bhagavant + to
Derivative taddhita (to)
Phonetic Change j > g
Sanskrit bhagavataḥ
Sanskrit Root √bhaj 1 (divide, share)

bhagavaṃmūlakā no, bhante, dhammā bhagavaṃnettikā bhagavaṃpaṭisaraṇā. sādhu vata, bhante, bhagavantaṃ'y'eva paṭibhātu etassa bhāsitassa attho. bhagavato sutvā bhikkhū dhāressantī'ti.

AN 10.58 mūlakasuttaṃ

etassa bhagavā kālo, etassa sugata kālo, yaṃ bhagavā dhammaṃ deseyya. bhagavato sutvā bhikkhū dhāressantī'ti.

MN 105 sunakkhattasuttaṃ
bhagavant 1

masc. Sublime One; Blessed One; Fortunate One; Auspicious One; epithet of the Buddha; lit. having good fortune quality [√bhaj + a + vant] ✓

Grammar masc, from bhaga
Meaning Sublime One; Blessed One; Fortunate One; Auspicious One; epithet of the Buddha; lit. having good fortune quality
Root Family √bhaj
Root √bhaj･1 a (divide, distribute)
Construction √bhaj > bhag + a + vant
bhaga + vant
Derivative taddhita (vant)
Phonetic Change j > g
Sanskrit bhagavat
Sanskrit Root √bhaj 1 (divide, share)

anejaṃ mūladassāviṃ,
atthi pañhena āgamaṃ,
kiṃ nissitā isayo manujā,
khattiyā brāhmaṇā devatānaṃ,
yaññam'akappayiṃsu puthū'dha loke,
pucchāmi taṃ bhagavā brūhi me taṃ.

SNP 58 puṇṇaka māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 3

bhagavaṃmūlakā no, bhante, dhammā bhagavaṃnettikā bhagavaṃpaṭisaraṇā. sādhu vata, bhante, bhagavantaṃ'y'eva paṭibhātu etassa bhāsitassa attho. bhagavato sutvā bhikkhū dhāressantī'ti.

AN 10.58 mūlakasuttaṃ
bhagavant 2

adj. fortunate [√bhaj] ✗
bhagavantarūpa

masc. someone like the Buddha ✗
bhagavannettika

adj. guided by the Blessed one; led by the Buddha [bhagavaṃ + nettika] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning guided by the Blessed one; led by the Buddha
Construction bhagavaṃ + nettika
Phonetic Change ṃ > n
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (bhagavaṃ + nettika)
Variant bhagavaṃnettika
Commentary (SNa) bhagavaṃnettikā'ti, bhagavā hi dhammānaṃ netā vinetā anunetāti. yathāsabhāvato pāṭiyekkaṃ pāṭiyekkaṃ nāmaṃ gahetvā dassitā dhammā bhagavaṃnettikā nāma honti.
Sanskrit bhagavat + netṛ +
bhagavampaṭisaraṇa

adj. relying on the Blessed One; depending on the Buddha [bhagavaṃ + paṭisaraṇa] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning relying on the Blessed One; depending on the Buddha
Construction bhagavaṃ + paṭisaraṇa
Phonetic Change ṃ > m
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (bhagavaṃ + paṭisaraṇa)
Variant bhagavaṃpaṭisaraṇa
Commentary (SNa) bhagavaṃpaṭisaraṇā'ti catubhūmakadhammā sabbaññutaññāṇassa āpāthaṃ āgacchamānā bhagavati paṭisaranti nāmāti bhagavaṃpaṭisaraṇā
Sanskrit bhagavat + pratisaraṇa

adj. guided by the Blessed one; led by the Buddha [bhagavaṃ + nettika] ✓

bhagavaṃmūlaka

adj. rooted in the Blessed One; stemming from the Buddha [bhagavaṃ + mūlaka] ✓

Meaning rooted in the Blessed One; stemming from the Buddha
Construction bhagavaṃ + mūlaka

AN 10.58 mūlakasuttaṃ
bhagavā

masc. Sublime One; Blessed One; Fortunate One; epithet of the Buddha [√bhaj + a + vant + ā] ✓

Meaning Sublime One; Blessed One; Fortunate One; epithet of the Buddha
Root Family √bhaj
Root √bhaj･1 a (divide, distribute)

bhaga + vā
Phonetic Change j > g
Sanskrit bhagavat
Sanskrit Root √bhaj 1 (divide, share)

atha kho bhagavā bhikkhū āmantesi, handa dāni, bhikkhave, āmantayāmi vo, vayadhammā saṅkhārā appamādena sampādethā'ti. ayaṃ tathāgatassa pacchimā vācā.

idam'avoca bhagavā. attamanā te bhikkhū bhagavato bhāsitaṃ abhinandun'ti.

bhaginisutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 15.17 (SN15.17) ✗
bhaginī 1

fem. sister [√bhaj + a + inī] ✓

Grammar fem, from bhaga
Meaning sister
Root Family √bhaj
Root √bhaj･1 a (divide, distribute)
Construction √bhaj > bhag + a + inī
bhaga + inī
Derivative taddhita (inī)
Phonetic Change j > g
Variant bhagini
Sanskrit bhaginī
Sanskrit Root √bhaj 1 (divide, share)

mātā'pi puttena vivadati, putto'pi mātarā vivadati, pitā'pi puttena vivadati, putto'pi pitarā vivadati, bhātā'pi bhātarā vivadati, bhātā'pi bhaginiyā vivadati, bhaginī'pi bhātarā vivadati, sahāyo'pi sahāyena vivadati.

MN 13 mahādukkhakkhandhasuttaṃ

bhūtapubbāhaṃ, pāpima, dūsī nāma māro ahosiṃ, tassa me kāḷī nāma bhaginī. tassā tvaṃ putto. so me tvaṃ bhāgineyyo ahosi. tena kho pana, pāpima, samayena kakusandho bhagavā arahaṃ sammāsambuddho loke uppanno hoti.

muṭṭhīhi'pi yujjhanti, raṅgamajjhe'pi saṅghāṭiṃ pattharitvā naccakiṃ evaṃ vadanti, idha, bhagini, naccassū'ti, nalāṭikam'pi denti, vividham'pi anācāraṃ ācaranti.

AN 7.63 bhariyāsuttaṃ
bhagu 1

masc. name of a monk ✗
bhagu 2

masc. name of a Vedic sage ✗
bhaguttheragāthā

fem. Theragāthā 187 (TH187) ✗
bhagga 1

pp. broken; shattered; fractured [√bhañj + ta] ✓

Grammar pp of bhañjati
Meaning broken; shattered; fractured
Root Family √bhañj
Root √bhañj･1 a (break, destroy)
Construction √bhañj > bhañg + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change jt > gg
Synonym pabhinna
Sanskrit bhagna
Sanskrit Root √bhañj 7 (break)

gahakāraka diṭṭho'si,
puna gehaṃ na kāhasi,
sabbā te phāsukā bhaggā,
gahakūṭaṃ visaṅkhataṃ,
visaṅkhāragataṃ cittaṃ,
taṇhānaṃ khayam'ajjhagā.

bhagga 3

nt. luck, fortune [√bhaj] ✗
bhaggava

masc. family name; lit. from Bhaggu [bhaggu + *a] ✓

Grammar masc, patr, from bhaggu
Meaning family name; lit. from Bhaggu
Construction bhaggu > bhaggav + *a
Derivative taddhita (*a)
Phonetic Change u > av
Notes (MW) bhārgava relating to or coming from Bhṛgu
Sanskrit bhārgava

evam'etaṃ tadā āsi,
yathā bhāsasi bhaggava,
kumbhakāro pure āsi,
vekaḷiṅge ghaṭīkaro,
mātāpettibharo āsi,
kassapassa upāsako.

SN 1.50 ghaṭīkārasuttaṃ
bhaggavagotta

Meaning name of a wandering ascetic; lit. from the Bhaggava family clan
Construction bhaggava + gotta
bhaggā

masc. name of the people of Bhagga; Bhaggans [bhagga + ā] ✓

Grammar masc pl of bhagga
Meaning name of the people of Bhagga; Bhaggans
Construction bhagga + ā
Commentary (MNa) bhaggesū'ti evaṃnāmake janapade, vacan'attho pan'ettha vutt'ānusāren'eva veditabbo.
Sanskrit bharga

evaṃ me sutaṃ, ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā bhaggesu viharati susumāragire bhesakaḷāvane migadāye. tena kho pana samayena āyasmā mahāmoggallāno magadhesu kallavāḷaputtagāme pacalāyamāno nisinno hoti.

AN 7.61 pacalāyamānasuttaṃ

evaṃ me sutaṃ, ekaṃ samayaṃ āyasmā mahāmoggallāno bhaggesu viharati susumāragire bhesakaḷāvane migadāye.

MN 15 anumānasuttaṃ
bhaṅga 1

masc. breaker; destroyer [√bhañj + a] ✓

Grammar masc, agent, from bhañjati
Meaning breaker; destroyer
Root Family √bhañj
Root √bhañj･1 a (break, destroy)
Construction √bhañj > bhaṅg + a
Derivative kita (a)
Phonetic Change ñj > ṅg
Sanskrit bhaṅga
Sanskrit Root √bhañj 7 (break)

sare hatthehi bhañjitvā,
katvāna kuṭim'acchisaṃ,
tena me sarabhaṅgo'ti,
nāmaṃ sammutiyā ahu.

bhaṅga 3

adj. hempen; canvas; made of hemp [√bhañj + a] ✓

Grammar adj, from bhañjati
Meaning hempen; canvas; made of hemp
Root Family √bhañj
Root √bhañj･1 a (break, destroy)
Construction √bhañj > bhaṅg + a
Derivative kita (a)
Phonetic Change ñj > ṅg
Notes six types of robe cloth 1. khoma, 2. kappāsika, 3. koseyya, 4. kambala, 5. sāṇa, 6. bhaṅga
Sanskrit bhaṅga
Sanskrit Root √bhañj 7 (break)

suttaṃ nāma cha suttāni, khomaṃ kappāsikaṃ koseyyaṃ kambalaṃ sāṇaṃ bhaṅgaṃ

VIN 1.4.3.6 suttaviññattisikkhāpadaṃ

channaṃ cīvarānaṃ aññataran'ti khomaṃ, kappāsikaṃ, koseyyaṃ, kambalaṃ, sāṇaṃ, bhaṅgan'ti imesaṃ channaṃ cīvarānaṃ aññataraṃ.

VINa 1.4.1.1 paṭhamakathinasikkhāpadavaṇṇanā
bhaṅga 4

nt. hempen cloth [√bhañj] ✗

bhacca 1

adj. to be supported; to be nurtured; lit. to be borne [√bhar + tya] ✓

Grammar adj, in comps, ptp of bharati
Meaning to be supported; to be nurtured; lit. to be borne
Root Family √bhar
Root √bhar･1 a (carry, support)
Construction √bhar + tya
Derivative kicca (tya)
Phonetic Change ty > cc
Sanskrit bhṛtya
Sanskrit Root √bhṛ 1 (bear)

atha kho jīvako komārabhacco seṭṭhiṃ gahapatiṃ mañcake nipātetvā sambandhitvā sīsacchaviṃ uppāṭetvā sibbiniṃ vināmetvā dve pāṇake nīharitvā mahājanassa dassesi.

VIN 4.8.205 rājagahaseṭṭhi vatthu
bhacca 2

masc. servant, dependant [√bhar] ✗
bhajati 1.1

pr. (+acc) associates (with); keeps company (with) [√bhaj + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning associates (with); keeps company (with)
Root Family √bhaj
Root √bhaj･1 a (associate, keep company)
Base √bhaj + a > bhaja
Construction bhaja + ti
Synonym sevati, upasevati
Sanskrit bhajati
Sanskrit Root √bhaj 1 (divide, share)

nidhīnaṃ'va pavattāraṃ,
yaṃ passe vajjadassinaṃ,
niggayhavādiṃ medhāviṃ,
t'ādisaṃ paṇḍitaṃ bhaje,
t'ādisaṃ bhajamānassa,
seyyo hoti na pāpiyo.

DHP 76 paṇḍitavaggo

nihīyati puriso nihīnasevī,
na ca hāyetha kadāci tulyasevī,
seṭṭham'upanamaṃ udeti khippaṃ,
tasmā attano uttariṃ bhajethā'ti.

saddho sīlena sampanno,
yasobhogasamappito,
yaṃ yaṃ padesaṃ bhajati,
tattha tatth'eva pūjito.

DHP 303 pakiṇṇakavaggo

idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu vivittaṃ sen'āsanaṃ bhajati

Sanskrit Root √bhaj 1 (divide, share)

ye naṃ dadanti saddhāya,
vippasannena cetasā,
tam'eva annaṃ bhajati,
asmiṃ loke paramhi ca.

methunaṃ vippajahe savibhūsaṃ.

sace adinnaṃ n'ādiyasi,
saddahāno amaccharī,
kiṃ kāhasi gayaṃ gantvā,
udapāno'pi te gayā'ti.

MN 7 vatthasuttaṃ

evam'eva kho, rāhula, yassa kassaci sampajānamusāvāde n'atthi lajjā, n'āhaṃ tassa kiñci pāpaṃ akaraṇīyan'ti vadāmi. tasmā't'iha te, rāhula, hassā'pi na musā bhaṇissāmī'ti.

MN 61 ambalaṭṭhika rāhulovādasuttaṃ
bhaṇati 2

pr. (+acc) preaches [√bhaṇ] ✗

Root √bhaṇ･1 a (talk, speak)
Base √bhaṇ + a > bhaṇa
Construction bhaṇa + nta
Derivative kita (nta)
Sanskrit bhaṇat
Sanskrit Root √bhaṇ 1 (speak)

jayaṃ ve maññati bālo,
vācāya pharusaṃ bhaṇaṃ,
jayañ'c'ev'assa taṃ hoti,
yā titikkhā vijānato.

SN 7.3 asurindakasuttaṃ

atha kho āyasmā udāyī yena sā kumārikā ten'upasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā tassā kumārikāya saddhiṃ eko ekāya raho paṭicchanne āsane alaṃkammaniye nisajjaṃ kappesi kālayuttaṃ samullapanto kālayuttaṃ dhammaṃ bhaṇanto

VIN 1.3.1 paṭhamāniyata sikkhāpadaṃ

bhaṇāmase

imp. (+acc) we must speak, say, tell, let us chant, proclaim [√bhaṇ] ✗

Grammar aor of bhaṇati, trans (+acc)

Sanskrit bhāṇ
Sanskrit Root √bhaṇ 1 (speak)
bhaṇita 1

nt. speech; talk; lit. spoken [√bhaṇ + ita] ✓

Grammar nt, pp of bhaṇati
Meaning speech; talk; lit. spoken
Root Family √bhaṇ
Root √bhaṇ･1 a (talk, speak)
Construction √bhaṇ + ita
Derivative kita (ita)
Sanskrit bhaṇita
Sanskrit Root √bhaṇ 1 (speak)

puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhū bhikkhuṃ āpattiyā codenti. so bhikkhu bhikkhūhi āpattiyā codiyamāno codakaṃ'y'eva paṭippharati, kiṃ nu kho tuyhaṃ bālassa abyattassa bhaṇitena!

AN 8.14 assakhaḷuṅkasuttaṃ
bhaṇita 2

Grammar pp of bhaṇati (+instr)

Construction √bhaṇ + ita
Derivative kita (ita)
Sanskrit bhaṇita
Sanskrit Root √bhaṇ 1 (speak)

bhante nāgasena, bhāsitam'p'etaṃ tathāgatena, abyāvaṭā tumhe, ānanda, hotha tathāgatassa sarīrapūjāyā'ti. puna ca bhaṇitaṃ,
pūjetha naṃ pūjaniyassa dhātuṃ,
evaṃ karā saggamito gamissathā'ti.

MIL 4.3.7 buddhapūjanapañho

tucchaṃ musā vilapin'ti tucchakaṃ mayā bhaṇitaṃ, musā mayā bhaṇitaṃ, abhūtaṃ mayā bhaṇitaṃ, ajānantena mayā bhaṇitaṃ.

AN 8.14 assakhaḷuṅkasuttaṃ

Sanskrit Root √bhaṇ 1 (speak)

tena hi, bhaṇe, yo bāhiresu janapadesu āyo sañjāyati tato upaḍḍhaṃ antepure pavesetha, upaḍḍhaṃ tatth'eva dānaṃ detha samaṇa-brāhmaṇa-kapaṇ'addhika-vanibbaka-yācakānan'ti.

SN 2.23 serīsuttaṃ

alaṃ, bhaṇe jīvaka, tuyham'eva hotu. amhākaññ'eva antepure nivesanaṃ māpehī'ti.

MIL 2.3.10 milindapañho, saññālakkhaṇapañho

Construction bhaṇḍānaṃ + uttama

Commentary (SNa) itthī'ti avissajjanīyabhaṇḍattā, itthī bhaṇḍānam'uttamaṃ, varabhaṇḍan'ti āha. atha vā sabbe'pi bodhisattā ca cakkavattino ca mātukucchiyaṃ'y'eva nibbattantī'ti, itthī bhaṇḍānam'uttaman'ti āha.
Sanskrit bhāṇḍānām + uttama

kiṃsu issariyaṃ loke,
kiṃsu bhaṇḍānam'uttamaṃ.
kiṃsu satthamalaṃ loke,
kiṃsu lokasmim'abbudaṃ.

SN 1.77 issariyasuttaṃ

vaso issariyaṃ loke,
itthī bhaṇḍānam'uttamaṃ,
kodho satthamalaṃ loke,
corā lokasmim'abbudā.

ṭhānaṃ kho pan'etaṃ, āvuso, vijjati yaṃ idh'ekaccassa bhikkhuno evaṃ icchā uppajjeyya, aho vata mam'eva bhikkhū purakkhatvā purakkhatvā gāmaṃ bhattāya paviseyyuṃ, na aññaṃ bhikkhuṃ bhikkhū purakkhatvā purakkhatvā gāmaṃ bhattāya paviseyyun'ti.

yo brāhmaṇaṃ samaṇaṃ vā,
bhattakāle upaṭṭhite,
roseti vācā na ca deti,
taṃ jaññā vasalo iti.

SNP 7 vasalasuttaṃ
uragavaggo 7

bhattagga

Grammar nt, comp

Construction bhatta + agga

Commentary (MNa) bhatt'agge'ti bhojanaṭṭhāne.
Sanskrit bhaktāgra

so āsanāni paṭisāmeti, pānīyaṃ paribhojanīyaṃ paṭisāmeti, avakkārapātiṃ paṭisāmeti, bhatt'aggaṃ sammajjati

MN 31 cūḷagosiṅgasuttaṃ

ṭhānaṃ kho pan'etaṃ, āvuso, vijjati yaṃ idh'ekaccassa bhikkhuno evaṃ icchā uppajjeyya, aho vata aham'eva labheyyaṃ bhatt'agge agg'āsanaṃ agg'odakaṃ aggapiṇḍaṃ, na añño bhikkhu labheyya bhatt'agge agg'āsanaṃ agg'odakaṃ aggapiṇḍan'ti.

MN 5 anaṅgaṇasuttaṃ
bhattantarāya

masc. missed meal; lit. meal obstacle [bhatta + antarāya] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning missed meal; lit. meal obstacle
Construction bhatta + antarāya
Compound catutthī tappurisa (bhattāya + antarāya)
Sanskrit bhakta + antarāya

chattiṃsaṃ kho pana, bhikkhave, rattisahassāni jīvanto dvesattati'y'eva bhattasahassāni bhuñjati, catuvīsati bhattasahassāni hemantānaṃ, catuvīsati bhattasahassāni gimhānaṃ, catuvīsati bhattasahassāni vassānaṃ saddhiṃ mātuthaññāya saddhiṃ bhatt'antarāyena.

AN 7.74 arakasuttaṃ

tatr'ime bhattantarāyā kapimiddho'pi bhattaṃ na bhuñjati, dukkhito'pi bhattaṃ na bhuñjati, byādhito'pi bhattaṃ na bhuñjati, uposathiko'pi bhattaṃ na bhuñjati, alābhaken'api bhattaṃ na bhuñjati.

sa kho so, bhikkhave, paṇḍito byatto kusalo sūdo sakassa bhattu nimittaṃ uggaṇhāti, idaṃ vā me ajja bhattu sūpeyyaṃ ruccati, imassa vā abhiharati, imassa vā bahuṃ gaṇhāti, imassa vā vaṇṇaṃ bhāsati.

bhattā paññāṇam'itthiyā'ti.

SN 1.72 rathasuttaṃ

idha, visākhe, mātugāmo ye te bhattu abbhantarā kamm'antā, uṇṇā'ti vā kappāsā'ti vā, tattha dakkhā hoti analasā tatr'upāyāya vīmaṃsāya samannāgatā alaṃ kātuṃ alaṃ saṃvidhātuṃ.

VIN 1.4.1.10 rājasikkhāpadaṃ
bhattasammada

masc. drowsiness after eating; passing out after eating; lit. food intoxication [bhatta + sammada] ✓

Grammar masc, abstr, comp
Meaning drowsiness after eating; passing out after eating; lit. food intoxication
Construction bhatta + sammada
Compound kammadhāraya (bhatta + sammada)
Commentary (SNa) bhattasammado'ti bhattamucchā bhattakilamatho. (SNa) bhattasammado'ti bhattapariḷāho. (VIBH) tattha katamo bhattasammado? yā bhuttāvissa bhattamucchā bhattakilamatho bhattapariḷāho kāyaduṭṭhullaṃ, ayaṃ vuccati bhattasammado.
Sanskrit bhakta + samada

n'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, aññaṃ ekadhammam'pi samanupassāmi yena anuppannaṃ vā thīnamiddhaṃ uppajjati uppannaṃ vā thinamiddhaṃ bhiyyobhāvāya vepullāya saṃvattati yatha'y'idaṃ, bhikkhave, arati tandī vijambhikā bhattasammado cetaso ca līnattaṃ

AN 1.13 nīvaraṇappahānavaggo

niddā tandī vijambhitā,
aratī bhattasammado,
etena nappakāsati,
ariyamaggo idha pāṇinan'ti.

yā evarūpā purisassa bhariyā,
bhaginī ca bhariyā’ti ca sā pavuccati.

tatra kho bhagavā bhikkhū āmantesi, bhikkhavo'ti. bhadante'ti te bhikkhū bhagavato paccassosuṃ. bhagavā etadavoca

AN 6.14 bhaddakasuttaṃ

sādhu sādhu, bhikkhu! bhaddako kho te, bhikkhu, ummaggo, bhaddakaṃ paṭibhānaṃ, kalyāṇī paripucchā

bhaddaka 2

nt. lucky or good thing [√bhad] ✗

bhaddikā, bhante, āvaṭṭanī māyā. kalyāṇī, bhante, āvaṭṭanī māyā. piyā me, bhante, ñātisālohitā imāya āvaṭṭaniyā āvaṭṭeyyuṃ, piyānam'pi me assa ñātisālohitānaṃ dīgharattaṃ hitāya sukhāya.

DN 14.13 mahāpadānasuttaṃ

bhagavaṃmūlakā no, bhante, dhammā bhagavaṃnettikā bhagavaṃpaṭisaraṇā. sādhu vata, bhante, bhagavantaṃ'y'eva paṭibhātu etassa bhāsitassa attho. bhagavato sutvā bhikkhū dhāressantī'ti.

AN 10.58 mūlakasuttaṃ
bhabba 1

adj. (+inf or +dat) able (to); capable (of); possible (to); likely (to); fit (to); lit. to be [√bhū + *ya] ✓

Grammar adj, ptp of bhavati (+inf or +dat)
Meaning able (to); capable (of); possible (to); likely (to); fit (to); lit. to be
Root Family √bhū
Root √bhū･1 a (be, become)
Construction √bhū > bhav > bhab + *ya
Derivative kicca (*ya)
Phonetic Change ū > av
v > b
Antonym abhabba
Variant bhabya
Commentary (MNa) bhabbo'ti anurūpo, anucchaviko.
Sanskrit bhavya
Sanskrit Root √bhū 1 (be)

catūh'apāyehi ca vippamutto,
cha c'ābhiṭhānāni bhabba kātuṃ,
idam'pi saṅghe ratanaṃ paṇītaṃ,
etena saccena suvatthi hotu.

SNP 13 ratanasuttaṃ,
cūḷavaggo 1

pañcahi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato bhikkhu bhabbo sammāsamādhiṃ upasampajja viharituṃ. katamehi pañcahi?

sassato'riva khāyati,
passato n'atthi kiñcanan'ti.

UD 70 utenasuttaṃ
bhabbarūpatā

fem. suitability of appearance; looking the part; lit. suitable form state [bhabba + rūpa + tā] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, comp, from bhabbarūpa
Meaning suitability of appearance; looking the part; lit. suitable form state
Construction bhabba + rūpa + tā
bhabbarūpa + tā
Derivative taddhita (tā)
Commentary (ANa) mā bhabbarūpatāyā'ti ayaṃ bhikkhu bhabbarūpo, imassa kathaṃ gahetuṃ yuttan'ti'pi mā gaṇhittha.
Sanskrit bhavya + rūpatā

etha tumhe, kālāmā, mā anussavena, mā paramparāya, mā itikirāya, mā piṭakasampadānena, mā takkahetu, mā nayahetu, mā ākāraparivitakkena, mā diṭṭhinijjhānakkhantiyā, mā bhabbarūpatāya, mā samaṇo no garū'ti.

MN 10 mahāsatipaṭṭhānasuttaṃ
bhamati

pr. (+loc) roams about (in); whirls about (in); spins about (in) [√bham + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, intrans (+loc)
Meaning roams about (in); whirls about (in); spins about (in)
Root Family √bham
Root √bham･1 a (turn, revolve, buzz)
√ In Comps bbham
Base √bham + a > bhama
Construction bhama + ti
Sanskrit bhramati
Sanskrit Root √bhram 1, 4 (wander)

jhāya bhikkhu mā pamādo,
mā te kāmaguṇe bhamassu cittaṃ,
mā lohaguḷaṃ gilī pamatto,
mā kandi dukkham'idan'ti ḍayhamāno.

DHP 371 bhikkhuvaggo
bhamanta

prp. revolving, whirling about, roaming [√bham] ✗

yathā'pi bhamaro pupphaṃ,
vaṇṇagandham'aheṭhayaṃ,
paleti rasam'ādāya,
evaṃ gāme munī care.

DHP 49 pupphavaggo

tasmiṃ samaye mūlato paṭṭhāya yāva aggasākhā sabbaṃ ekapāliphullaṃ ahosi, sākh'antarehi c'eva pupph'antarehi ca pañcavaṇṇā bhamaragaṇā nānappakārā ca sakuṇasaṅghā madhurassarena vikūjantā vicaranti.

MN 91 brahmāyusuttaṃ

cakkhussa rahonāma na sakkā hoti akkhiṃ vā nikhaṇīyamāne bhamukaṃ vā ukkhipīyamāne sīsaṃ vā ukkhipīyamāne passituṃ. sotassa rahonāma na sakkā hoti pakatikathā sotuṃ.

VIN 1.3.1 paṭhamāniyatasikkhāpadaṃ
bhaya 1

adj. dangerous; perilous; frightening [√bhī + *a] ✓

Grammar adj, from bhāyati
Meaning dangerous; perilous; frightening
Root Family √bhī
Root √bhī･1 a (fear)
Construction √bhī > bhay + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change ī > ay
Antonym abhaya
Sanskrit bhaya
Sanskrit Root √bhī 1, 3, 10 (fear)

vāṇijo'va bhayaṃ maggaṃ,
appasattho mahaddhano,
visaṃ jīvitu'kāmo'va,
pāpāni parivajjaye.

DHP 123 pāpavaggo
bhaya 2

nt. (+loc) fear (of); terror (of); fright; dismay [√bhī + *a] ✓

Grammar nt, from bhāyati (+loc)
Meaning fear (of); terror (of); fright; dismay
Root Family √bhī
Root √bhī･1 a (fear)
Construction √bhī > bhay + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change ī > ay
Antonym abhaya
Commentary (MNa) bhayaṃ sāvajj'aṭṭhena akusalaṃ
Sanskrit bhaya
Sanskrit Root √bhī 1, 3, 10 (fear)

khīṇāya bhavanettiyā,
diṭṭhe dhamme yathātathe,
na bhayaṃ maraṇe hoti,
bhāranikkhepane yathā.

TH 248 adhimuttattheragāthā

araññe rukkhamūle vā,
suññ'āgāre'va bhikkhavo,
anussaretha sambuddhaṃ,
bhayaṃ tumhāka no siyā.

SN 11.3 dhajaggasuttaṃ
bhaya 3

Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change ī > ay
Antonym abhaya
Sanskrit bhaya
Sanskrit Root √bhī 1, 3, 10 (fear)

cattār'imāni, bhikkhave, bhayāni udak'orohantassa pāṭikaṅkhitabbāni. katamāni cattāri? ūmibhayaṃ, kumbhīlabhayaṃ, āvaṭṭabhayaṃ, susukābhayaṃ

AN 4.122 ūmibhayasuttaṃ

pañcannaṃ dhīro bhayānaṃ na bhāye,
bhikkhu sato sapariyantacārī,
ḍaṃs'ādhipātānaṃ sarīsapānaṃ,
manussaphassānaṃ catuppadānaṃ.

bhayagāmī

chandagāmino ca bhikkhū, dosagāmino ca bhikkhū, mohagāmino ca bhikkhū, bhayagāmino ca bhikkhū t'ādisikāya āpattiyā ekaccaṃ pabbājenti, ekaccaṃ na pabbājentī'ti.

ye'pi'ssa te honti dāsā'ti vā pessā'ti vā kammakarā'ti vā, te'pi daṇḍatajjitā bhayatajjitā assumukhā rudamānā parikammāni karonti.

AN 8.2 paññāsuttaṃ
bhayadassī

Variant bhayadassāvī
Sanskrit bhayadarśin

pamāde bhayadassi vā,
saṃyojanaṃ aṇuṃ thūlaṃ,
ḍahaṃ aggī'va gacchati.

DHP 31 appamādavaggo

appamādarato bhikkhu,
pamāde bhayadassi vā,
abhabbo parihānāya,
nibbānass'eva santike'ti.

piṇḍapātikassa bhikkhuno,

UD 27 sakkudānasuttaṃ

santussako ca subharo ca,
appakicco ca sallahukavutti,
sant'indriyo ca nipako ca,
appagabbho kulesu ananugiddho.

KHP 9 karaṇīya mettasuttaṃ
bharaṇa

nt. supporting; maintaining [√bhar + aṇa] ✓

Meaning supporting; maintaining

Sanskrit bharaṇa
Sanskrit Root √bhṛ 1 (bear)

siyā c'assa uttariṃ avasiṭṭhaṃ dārabharaṇāya

MN 39 mahāassapurasuttaṃ
bharaṇḍu

masc. name of an ascetic; the Buddha's former companion under Āḷāra Kālāma ~

Grammar masc
Meaning name of an ascetic; the Buddha's former companion under Āḷāra Kālāma
bharaṇḍukālāmasutta

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 3.127 (AN3.127) ✗
bharata

masc. name of one the seven Bharata kings ~

Grammar masc
Meaning name of one the seven Bharata kings
Sanskrit bharata
bharataka

masc. wealthy householders; derogatory name for Buddhist lay followers; lit. related to the Bharatas [bharata + ka] ~

Grammar masc, from bharata
Meaning wealthy householders; derogatory name for Buddhist lay followers; lit. related to the Bharatas
Construction bharata + ka
Derivative taddhita (ka)
Commentary (SNa) bharatakānan'ti kuṭimbikānaṃ. kuṭimbikā hi yasmā raṭṭhaṃ bharanti, tasmā bharatā'ti vuccanti. ime pana paribhavaṃ katvā vadamānā bharatakānan'ti āhaṃsu.
bharatattheragāthā

fem. Theragāthā 148 (TH148) ✗
bharati

pr. (+acc) bears; supports; maintains [√bhar + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning bears; supports; maintains
Root Family √bhar
Root √bhar･1 a (carry, support)
Base √bhar + a > bhara
Construction bhara + ti
Sanskrit bharati
Sanskrit Root √bhṛ 1 (bear)

yo mātaraṃ vā pitaraṃ vā,
jiṇṇakaṃ gatayobbanaṃ,
pahu santo na bharati,
taṃ parābhavato mukhaṃ.

SNP 6 parābhavasuttaṃ
uragavaggo 6
bharabhara

masc. crinkling sound; crackling sound [bhara + bhara] ✓

Grammar masc, onom
Meaning crinkling sound; crackling sound
Construction bhara + bhara
Variant bhabbhara
Sanskrit ?? gargara, bababā

so evaṃ vadeyya, ahaṃ imaṃ biḷārabhastaṃ madditaṃ sumadditaṃ suparimadditaṃ, mudukaṃ tūliniṃ, chinnasassaraṃ chinnabhabbharaṃ kaṭṭhena vā kathalena vā sarasaraṃ karissāmi bharabharaṃ karissāmī'ti.

MN 21 kakacūpamasuttaṃ
bhari

aor. bear, supports, maintains [√bhar] ✗
bharitvā

abs. having born, having supported [√bhar] ✗
bhariyagaṇa

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning group of wives
Construction bhariyā + gaṇa
bhariyā

fem. wife; lit. to be supported [√bhar + iya + ā] ✓

Grammar fem, from bhariya
Meaning wife; lit. to be supported
Root Family √bhar
Root √bhar･1 a (carry, support)
Construction √bhar + iya + ā
bhariya + ā
Derivative taddhita (ā)
Variant bhariyāva
Sanskrit bhāryā
Sanskrit Root √bhṛ 1 (bear)

khattiyo dvipadaṃ seṭṭho,
balībaddo catuppadaṃ,
komārī seṭṭhā bhariyānaṃ,
yo ca puttāna pubbajo'ti.

SN 1.14 khattiyasuttaṃ

mātaraṃ kuṭikaṃ brūsi,
bhariyaṃ brūsi kulāvakaṃ,
putte santānake brūsi,
taṇhaṃ me brūsi bandhanan'ti.

fem. Theragāthā 7 (TH7) ✗
bhava 1

imp. (+nom) be!; you must be! [√bhū + a + a] ✓

Grammar imp 2nd sg of bhavatu, intrans (+nom)
Meaning be!; you must be!
Root Family √bhū
Root √bhū･1 a (be, become)
Base √bhū + a > bhava
Construction bhava + a
Phonetic Change ū > av
Sanskrit bhava
Sanskrit Root √bhū 1 (be)

so karohi dīpam'attano,
khippaṃ vāyama paṇḍito bhava,
niddhantamalo anaṅgaṇo,
dibbaṃ ariyabhūmiṃ upehisi.

DHP 236 malavaggo

moneyyaṃ te upaññissaṃ,
dukkaraṃ durabhisambhavaṃ,
handa te naṃ pavakkhāmi,
santhambhassu daḷho bhava.

SNP 37 nālakasuttaṃ
mahāvaggo 11
bhava 2

masc. being; becoming; existence [√bhū + *a] ✓

Grammar masc, from bhavati
Meaning being; becoming; existence
Root Family √bhū
Root √bhū･1 a (be, become)
Construction √bhū > bhav + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change ū > av
Antonym vibhava
Sanskrit bhava
Sanskrit Root √bhū 1 (be)

bhavasaṃyojane ca kho appahīne bhavo'pi appahīno hotī'ti, iti vadaṃ dhammam'eva deseti.

MN 139 araṇavibhaṅgasuttaṃ

yaṃ kiñci sampajānāsi,
uddhaṃ adho tiriyañ'c'āpi majjhe,
etesu nandiñ'ca nivesanañ'ca,
panujja viññāṇaṃ bhave na tiṭṭhe.

SNP 59 mettagū māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 4

kati pan'āvuso, bhavā'ti? tayo'me, āvuso, bhavā, kāmabhavo, rūpabhavo, arūpabhavo'ti.

MN 43 mahāvedallasuttaṃ

passāmi loke pariphandamānaṃ,
pajaṃ imaṃ taṇhagataṃ bhavesu,
hīnā narā maccumukhe lapanti,
avītataṇhāse bhav'ābhavesu.

SNP 40 guhaṭṭhakasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 2
bhava 4

nt. state of existence; form of becoming [√bhū + *a] ✓

Grammar nt, from bhavati
Meaning state of existence; form of becoming
Root Family √bhū
Root √bhū･1 a (be, become)
Construction √bhū > bhav + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change ū > av
Commentary (ITIa) bhavānī'ti liṅgavipallāsena vuttaṃ, upapattibhavā sabbaso anavasesā nirujjhanti, na pavattanti.
Notes normally masc
Sanskrit bhava
Sanskrit Root √bhū 1 (be)

duve imā cakkhumatā pakāsitā,
nibbānadhātū anissitena tādinā,
ekā hi dhātu idha diṭṭhadhammikā,
saupādisesā bhavanettisaṅkhayā,
anupādisesā pana samparāyikā,
yamhi nirujjhanti bhavāni sabbaso.

ITI 44 nibbānadhātusuttaṃ
bhava 5

masc. well-being; prosperity; development [√bhū + *a] ✓

Grammar masc, from bhavati
Meaning well-being; prosperity; development
Root Family √bhū
Root √bhū･1 a (be, become)
Construction √bhū > bhav + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change ū > av
Antonym vibhava, abhava
Commentary (DHPa) bhavāya vibhavāya cā'ti vuddhiyā ca avuddhiyā ca.
Sanskrit bhava
Sanskrit Root √bhū 1 (be)

yogā ve jāyatī bhūri,
ayogā bhūrisaṅkhayo,
etaṃ dvedhāpathaṃ ñatvā,
bhavāya vibhavāya ca,
tath'āttānaṃ niveseyya,
yathā bhūri pavaḍḍhati.

AN 4.10 yogasuttaṃ
bhavataṇhā

bhūtassa ca atikkamaṃ,
yathābhūte vimuccanti,
bhavataṇhā parikkhayā.

y'āyaṃ taṇhā ponobhavikā nandirāgasahagatā tatratatr'ābhinandinī, seyyath'idaṃ, kāmataṇhā bhavataṇhā vibhavataṇhā

tesaṃ vo, bhikkhave, evaṃsamaññānaṃ sataṃ evaṃpaṭiññānaṃ sataṃ, yā samaṇasāmīcippaṭipadā taṃ paṭipajjissāma. evaṃ no ayaṃ amhākaṃ samaññā ca saccā bhavissati paṭiññā ca bhūtā.

MN 40 cūḷāssapurasuttaṃ
bhavati 2

pr. (+dat) exists (for) [√bhū + a + ti] ✓

Construction bhava + ti
Phonetic Change ū > av

Sanskrit Root √bhū 1 (be)

saritāni sinehitāni ca,
somanassāni bhavanti jantuno,
te sātasitā sukh'esino,
te ve jātijar'ūpagā narā.

DHP 341 taṇhāvaggo

hoti so, bhikkhave, samayo yaṃ mahāsamuddo ussussati visussati na bhavati, na tv'ev'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, avijjānīvaraṇānaṃ sattānaṃ taṇhāsaṃyojanānaṃ sandhāvataṃ saṃsarataṃ dukkhassa antakiriyaṃ vadāmi.

phuṭṭhassa cittaṃ na vikampate kvaci,

bhavattha jātimaraṇassa pāragā'ti.

bhavanirodha

masc. ending of becoming; cessation of being; end of existence; (comm) Nibbāna [bhava + nirodha] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning ending of becoming; cessation of being; end of existence; (comm) Nibbāna
Construction bhava + nirodha
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (bhavassa + nirodha)
Commentary (MNa) bhavanirodho'ti nibbānaṃ.
Sanskrit bhava + nrodha

evaṃdiṭṭhino, bhikkhave, etaṃ pāṭikaṅkhaṃ, yā c'āyaṃ bhave appaṭikulyatā, sā c'assa na bhavissati. yā c'āyaṃ bhavanirodhe pāṭikulyatā, sā c'assa na bhavissatī'ti.

AN 10.29 paṭhamakosalasuttaṃ

vedanānirodhā taṇhānirodho, taṇhānirodhā upādānanirodho, upādānanirodhā bhavanirodho, bhavanirodhā jātinirodho, jātinirodhā jarāmaraṇaṃ sokaparidevadukkhadomanass'upāyāsā nirujjhanti.

SN 12.12 moḷiyaphaggunasuttaṃ
bhavanirodhagāmī

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning leading to the ending of existence; leading to the cessation of being
Construction bhavanirodha + gāmī
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (bhavanirodhaṃ + gāmī)
Sanskrit bhava + nirodha + gāmin

yato kho, āvuso, ariyasāvako bhavañ'ca pajānāti, bhavasamudayañ'ca pajānāti, bhavanirodhañ'ca pajānāti, bhavanirodhagāminiṃ paṭipadañ'ca pajānāti, ettāvatā'pi kho, āvuso, ariyasāvako sammādiṭṭhi hoti

MN 9 sammādiṭṭhisuttaṃ
bhavanetti

fem. conduit to existence; channel to becoming [bhava + netti] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning conduit to existence; channel to becoming
Construction bhava + netti
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (bhavaṃ + netti)
Sanskrit bhava + netrī

pariciṇṇo mayā satthā,
kataṃ buddhassa sāsanaṃ,
ohito garuko bhāro,
bhavanetti samūhatā.

TH 259 sāriputtattheragāthā

khīṇāya bhavanettiyā,
diṭṭhe dhamme yathātathe,
na bhayaṃ maraṇe hoti,
bhāranikkhepane yathā.

TH 248 adhimuttattheragāthā
bhavanettikhīṇa

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning ending of the conduit to existence; cessation of the channel to becoming
Construction bhavanetti + nirodha
bhavanettisaṅkhaya

masc. destruction of the conduit to existence; ending of the channel to becoming; (comm) extinction of craving [bhava + netti + saṅkhaya] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning destruction of the conduit to existence; ending of the channel to becoming; (comm) extinction of craving
Construction bhava + netti + saṅkhaya
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (bhavanettiyā + saṅkhaya)
Commentary (ITIa) bhavanettisaṅkhayā'ti bhavanettiyā taṇhāya parikkhayā.
Sanskrit bhava + netrī + saṃkṣaya

duve imā cakkhumatā pakāsitā,
nibbānadhātū anissitena tādinā,
ekā hi dhātu idha diṭṭhadhammikā,
saupādisesā bhavanettisaṅkhayā,
anupādisesā pana samparāyikā,
yamhi nirujjhanti bhavāni sabbaso.

ITI 44 nibbānadhātusuttaṃ

ye etadaññāya padaṃ asaṅkhataṃ,
vimuttacittā bhavanettisaṅkhayā,
te dhammasār'ādhigamā khaye ratā,
pahaṃsu te sabbabhavāni tādino'ti.

ITI 44 nibbānadhātusuttaṃ
bhavanettisutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 23.3 (SN23.3) ✗

Sanskrit bhavan
Sanskrit Root √bhū 1 (be)

labheyya nu kho so coro coraghātesu, āgamentu tāva bhavanto coraghātā, amukasmiṃ me gāme vā nigame vā mittāmaccā ñātisālohitā, yāvāhaṃ tesaṃ uddisitvā āgacchāmī'ti

handa, kuto nu bhavaṃ vacchāyano āgacchati divādivassā'ti?

SN 12.2 vibhaṅgasuttaṃ
bhavapañhāsutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 38.13 (SN38.13) ✗
bhavapaṭilābhiya

Commentary (ANa) bhavapaṭilābhiyānī'ti upapattibhavassa paṭilābhāya paccayāni.
bhavapariḷāha

masc. fever for being; burning passion for existence [bhava + pariḷāha] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning fever for being; burning passion for existence
Construction bhava + pariḷāha
Compound sattamī tappurisa (bhavesu + pariḷāha)
Sanskrit bhava + paridāha

tassa bhavānaṃ samudayañ'ca atthaṅ'gamañ'ca assādañ'ca ādīnavañ'ca nissaraṇañ'ca yathābhūtaṃ appajānato yo bhavesu bhavarāgo bhavanandī bhavasneho bhavamucchā bhavapipāsā bhavapariḷāho bhav'ajjhosānaṃ bhavataṇhā sānuseti.

AN 4.10 yogasuttaṃ
bhavapipāsā

fem. thirst for being; craving for existence [bhava + pipāsā] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning thirst for being; craving for existence
Construction bhava + pipāsā
Compound sattamī tappurisa (bhavesu + pipāsā)
Sanskrit bhava + pipāsā

tassa bhavānaṃ samudayañ'ca atthaṅ'gamañ'ca assādañ'ca ādīnavañ'ca nissaraṇañ'ca yathābhūtaṃ appajānato yo bhavesu bhavarāgo bhavanandī bhavasneho bhavamucchā bhavapipāsā bhavapariḷāho bhav'ajjhosānaṃ bhavataṇhā sānuseti.

AN 4.10 yogasuttaṃ
bhavappabhava

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning generated by being
Construction bhava + pabhava

Grammar nt, comp

Construction bhava + bandhana

Sanskrit bhava + bandhana

kusalī bhāsasī tesaṃ,
mārapāsappahāyinaṃ,
kassa te dhammam'aññāya,
acchiduṃ bhavabandhanan'ti.

bhavamatthu

sandhi. may you be well!; may you be happy!; lit. may one be well! [bhavaṃ + atthu] ✓

Grammar sandhi, masc + imp
Meaning may you be well!; may you be happy!; lit. may one be well!
Construction bhavaṃ + atthu
Sanskrit bhavika + astu

bhavam'atthu bhavantaṃ jotipālaṃ, rājā disampati bhavantaṃ jotipālaṃ māṇavaṃ āmantayati, rājā disampati bhoto jotipālassa māṇavassa dassanakāmo'ti

DN 19.7 mahāgovindasuttaṃ
bhavamāna 1

prp. (+nom) being possible; lit. being; existing [√bhū + a + māna] ✓

Grammar prp of bhavati, intrans (+nom)
Meaning being possible; lit. being; existing
Root Family √bhū
Root √bhū･1 a (be, become)
Base √bhū + a > bhava
Construction bhava + māna
Derivative kita (māna)
Phonetic Change ū > av
Commentary (MNa) kiṃ so bhavamāno saccako nigaṇṭhaputto, yo bhagavato vādaṃ āropessatī'ti yo saccako nigaṇṭhaputto bhagavato vādaṃ āropessati, so kiṃ bhavamāno kiṃ yakkho bhavamāno udāhu indo, udāhu brahmā bhavamāno bhagavato vādaṃ āropessati? na hi sakkā pakatimanussena bhagavato vādaṃ āropetun'ti ayam'ettha adhippāyo.
Sanskrit bhavamāna
Sanskrit Root √bhū 1 (be)

ekacce licchavī evam'āhaṃsu, kiṃ so bhavamāno saccako nigaṇṭhaputto yo bhagavato vādaṃ āropessati, atha kho bhagavā saccakassa nigaṇṭhaputtassa vādaṃ āropessatī'ti?

MN 35 cūḷasaccakasuttaṃ
bhavamāna 2

prp. (+nom) becoming, existing [√bhū] ✗

Sanskrit bhava + yoga

cattāro'me, bhikkhave, yogā. katame cattāro? kāmayogo, bhavayogo, diṭṭhiyogo, avijjāyogo.

AN 4.10 yogasuttaṃ
bhavarata

Sanskrit bhava + rata

bhavarāmāya vata, bho, pajāya bhavaratāya bhavasammuditāya samūlaṃ bhavaṃ udabbahī'ti.

MN 49 brahmanimantanikasuttaṃ

kathañ'ca, bhikkhave, olīyanti eke? bhav'ārāmā, bhikkhave, devamanussā bhavaratā bhavasammuditā tesaṃ bhavanirodhāya dhamme desiyamāne cittaṃ na pakkhandati na pasīdati na santiṭṭhati n'ādhimuccati.

ITI 49 diṭṭhigatasuttaṃ
bhavarāga

masc. passion for existence; desire to be; desire to become [bhava + rāga] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning passion for existence; desire to be; desire to become
Construction bhava + rāga
Compound sattamī tappurisa (bhave + rāga)
Sanskrit bhava + rāga

evam'eva kho, bhikkhave, aniccasaññā bhāvitā bahulīkatā sabbaṃ kāmarāgaṃ pariyādiyati sabbaṃ rūparāgaṃ pariyādiyati sabbaṃ bhavarāgaṃ pariyādiyati sabbaṃ avijjaṃ pariyādiyati sabbaṃ asmimānaṃ samūhanati.

SN 22.102 aniccasaññāsuttaṃ

āsīsanti thomayanti abhijappanti juhanti,
kām'ābhijappanti paṭicca lābhaṃ,
te yājayogā bhavarāgarattā,
n'ātariṃsu jātijaran'ti brūmi.

SNP 58 puṇṇaka māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 3

bhavasaṅkhāra

masc. intention to live; will to exist ✗
bhavasatta

Meaning attached to being; clinging to existence
Construction bhava + satta
Commentary (SNa) aññathābhāvī bhavasatto loko bhavamevābhinandatī'ti aññathābhāvaṃ vipariṇāmaṃ upagamanena aññathābhāvī hutvā'pi bhavesu satto laggo lagito palibuddho ayaṃ loko bhavaṃ'y'eva abhinandati.

Meaning source of being; arising of existence

adj. pleased with being; enjoying existence; happy to be [bhava + sammudita] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning pleased with being; enjoying existence; happy to be
Construction bhava + sammudita
Compound sattamī tappurisa (bhave + sammudita)
Sanskrit bhava + sumudita

kathañ'ca, bhikkhave, olīyanti eke? bhav'ārāmā, bhikkhave, devamanussā bhavaratā bhavasammuditā tesaṃ bhavanirodhāya dhamme desiyamāne cittaṃ na pakkhandati na pasīdati na santiṭṭhati n'ādhimuccati. evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, olīyanti eke.

ITI 49 diṭṭhigatasuttaṃ

bhavarāmāya vata, bho, pajāya bhavaratāya bhavasammuditāya samūlaṃ bhavaṃ udabbahī'ti.

Sanskrit bhava + śalya

niṭṭhaṅ'gato asantāsī,
vītataṇho anaṅgaṇo,
acchindi bhavasallāni,
antimo'yaṃ samussayo.

DHP 351 taṇhāvaggo
bhavasaṃyojana

nt. bondage to being; chain to existence [bhava + saṃyojana] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning bondage to being; chain to existence
Construction bhava + saṃyojana
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (bhavassa + saṃyojana)
Sanskrit bhava + saṃyojana

yesaṃ kesañci bhavasaṃyojanaṃ appahīnaṃ, sabbe te sadukkhā saupaghātā saupāyāsā sapariḷāhā micchāpaṭipannā'ti, iti vadaṃ itth'eke apasādeti.

MN 139 araṇavibhaṅgasuttaṃ

bhavasaṃyojane ca kho appahīne bhavo'pi appahīno hotī'ti, iti vadaṃ dhammam'eva deseti.

MN 139 araṇavibhaṅgasuttaṃ
bhavasaṃyojanakkhaya

masc. wearing away the chain of existence; exhausting the bond of being [bhava + saṃyojana + khaya] ✓

Meaning wearing away the chain of existence; exhausting the bond of being
Construction bhava + saṃyojana + khaya
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (bhavasaṃyojanassa + khaya)
Sanskrit bhava + saṃyojana + kṣaya

tato aññā vimuttassa,
ñāṇaṃ ve hoti tādino,
akuppā me vimuttī'ti,
bhavasaṃyojanakkhayā.

ITI 62 indriyasuttaṃ
bhavasātabaddha

adj. tied to the pleasure of existence; bound to the pleasure of being [bhava + sāta + baddha] ✓

Construction bhava + sāta + baddha
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (bhavasātaṃ + baddha)
Sanskrit bhava + śāta + baddha

icchānidānā bhavasātabaddhā,
te duppamuñcā na hi aññamokkhā,
pacchā pure v'āpi apekkhamānā,
ime'va kāme purime'va jappaṃ.

SNP 40 guhaṭṭhakasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 2
bhavasutta 1

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 45.164 (SN45.164) ✗
bhavasutta 2

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 6.105 (AN6.105) ✗

tesaṃ phassaparetānaṃ,
bhavasot'ānusārinaṃ,
kummaggapaṭipannānaṃ,
ārā saṃyojanakkhayo.

SNP 38 dvayatānupassanāsuttaṃ

tesu ussukkajātesu,
bhavasot'ānusārisu,
ke'dha taṇhaṃ pajahiṃsu,
ke lokasmiṃ anussukā'ti.

AN 4.10 yogasuttaṃ
bhavaṃ 1

masc. venerable; respectable person; honourable person; lit. being present [√bhū + a + anta + aṃ] ✓

Grammar masc, nom sg of bhavant, irreg
Meaning venerable; respectable person; honourable person; lit. being present
Root Family √bhū
Root √bhū･1 a (be, become)
Base √bhū + a > bhava
Construction bhava + anta + aṃ
bhavant + aṃ
Phonetic Change ū > av
Antonym parābhavo
Sanskrit bhavān
Sanskrit Root √bhū 1 (be)

suvijāno bhavaṃ hoti,
suvijāno parābhavo,
dhammakāmo bhavaṃ hoti,
dhammadessī parābhavo.

SNP 6 parābhavasuttaṃ
uragavaggo 6

puṭṭho kho pana pañh'ābhinīto ahāpetvā alambitvā paripūraṃ vitthārena parassa avaṇṇaṃ bhāsitā hoti. veditabbam'etaṃ, bhikkhave, asappuriso ayaṃ bhavan'ti.

AN 4.73 sappurisasuttaṃ
bhavaṃ 2

masc. master; sir; you [√bhū + a + anta + aṃ] ✓

Meaning master; sir; you

Root √bhū･1 a (be, become)

Construction bhava + anta + aṃ
bhavant + aṃ
Phonetic Change ū > av
Sanskrit bhavān
Sanskrit Root √bhū 1 (be)

kim'etaṃ bhavaṃ gotamo āha puna bhavaṃ gotamo bravitū'ti

DN 3.7 ambaṭṭhasuttaṃ

atha ca pana bhavaṃ gotamo evam'āha, aham'pi kho, brāhmaṇa, kasāmi ca vapāmi ca. kasitvā ca vapitvā ca bhuñjāmī'ti.

SNP 4 kasibhāradvājasuttaṃ
uragavaggo 4
bhavātha

imp. (+nom) you all must be! [√bhū + a + atha] ✓

Grammar imp 2nd pl of bhavatu, irreg form of bhavatha, intrans (+nom)
Meaning you all must be!
Root Family √bhū
Root √bhū･1 a (be, become)
Base √bhū + a > bhava
Construction bhava + atha > bhavātha
Phonetic Change with metrically lengthened ā
Sanskrit bhavata
Sanskrit Root √bhū 1 (be)

asso yathā bhadro kasāniviṭṭho,
ātāpino saṃvegino bhavātha,
saddhāya sīlena ca vīriyena ca,
samādhinā dhammavinicchayena ca,
sampannavijjācaraṇā patissatā,
jahissatha dukkham'idaṃ anappakaṃ.

DHP 144 daṇḍavaggo
bhavābhava

masc. existence or non-existence; being and non-being; any state of existence; (comm) repeated existence [bhava + abhava] ✓

Grammar masc, abstr, comp
Meaning existence or non-existence; being and non-being; any state of existence; (comm) repeated existence
Construction bhava + abhava
Compound dvanda (bhava ca abhava ca)
Commentary (SNPa) bhav'ābhavesū'ti kāmabhav'ādīsu. atha vā bhav'ābhavesū'ti bhavabhavesu, punappunabhavesū'ti vuttaṃ hoti.
Sanskrit bhavābhava

yass'ūbhay'ante paṇidh'īdha n'atthi,
bhav'ābhavāya idha vā huraṃ vā,
nivesanā tassa na santi keci,
dhammesu niccheyya samuggahītaṃ.

SNP 43 paramaṭṭhakasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 5

vidvā ca yo vedagū naro idha,
bhav'ābhave saṅgamimaṃ visajja,
so vītataṇho anīgho nirāso,
atāri so jātijaranti brūmī'ti.

SNP 59 mettagū māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 4
bhavābhinandī

adj. who delights in existence; loving life; very happy with life [bhava + abhinandī] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning who delights in existence; loving life; very happy with life
Construction bhava + abhinandī
Compound sattamī tappurisa (bhavasmiṃ + abhinandī)
Sanskrit bhava + abhinandin

ye tuyha chandena vasena vattino,
narā ca nārī ca anubhonti yaṃ sukhaṃ,
aviddasū māravas'ānuvattino,
bhav'ābhinandī tava citta sāvakā'ti.

TH 262 tālapuṭattheragāthā
bhavāma

pr. (+nom) we are; we become [√bhū + a + āma] ✓

Grammar pr 1st pl of bhavati, intrans (+nom)
Meaning we are; we become
Root Family √bhū
Root √bhū･1 a (be, become)
Base √bhū + a > bhava
Construction bhava + āma
Phonetic Change ū > av
Sanskrit bhavāmaḥ
Sanskrit Root √bhū 1 (be)

tvaññ'eva no citta karosi brāhmaṇo,
tvaṃ khattiyo rājadasī karosi,
vessā ca suddā ca bhavāma ekadā,
devattanaṃ v'āpi tav'eva vāhasā.

TH 262 tālapuṭattheragāthā
bhavāmase

imp. (+nom) we ourselves must become [√bhū + a + āmase] ✓

Grammar imp, reflx 1st pl of bhavatu, intrans (+nom)
Meaning we ourselves must become
Root Family √bhū
Root √bhū･1 a (be, become)
Base √bhū + a > bhava
Construction bhava + āmase
Phonetic Change ū > av
Sanskrit bhavāmahai
Sanskrit Root √bhū 1 (be)

tav'eva hetū asurā bhavāmase,
tvaṃmūlakaṃ nerayikā bhavāmase,
atho tiracchānagatā'pi ekadā,
petattanaṃ v'āpi tav'eva vāhasā.

TH 262 tālapuṭattheragāthā
bhavārāma

adj. enjoying being; taking pleasure in existence; fond of life [bhava + ārāma] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning enjoying being; taking pleasure in existence; fond of life
Construction bhava + ārāma
Compound sattamī tappurisa (bhavasmiṃ + ārāma)
Sanskrit bhava + ārāma

kathañ'ca, bhikkhave, olīyanti eke? bhav'ārāmā, bhikkhave, devamanussā bhavaratā bhavasammuditā tesaṃ bhavanirodhāya dhamme desiyamāne cittaṃ na pakkhandati na pasīdati na santiṭṭhati n'ādhimuccati.

ITI 49 diṭṭhigatasuttaṃ
bhavāsava

masc. effluent of becoming; effluent of being [bhava + āsava] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning effluent of becoming; effluent of being
Construction bhava + āsava
Compound kammadhāraya (bhava + āsava)
Sanskrit bhava + āsrava

tayo'me, bhikkhave, āsavā, kām'āsavo, bhav'āsavo, avijj'āsavo.

AN 6.63 nibbedhikasuttaṃ

tassa evaṃ jānato evaṃ passato kām'āsavā'pi cittaṃ vimuccati bhav'āsavā'pi cittaṃ vimuccati avijj'āsavā'pi cittaṃ vimuccati

MN 39 mahāassapurasuttaṃ
bhavāhi

imp. (+nom) be!; please be!; you must be! [√bhū + a + āhi] ✓

Grammar imp 2nd sg of bhavatu, intrans (+nom)
Meaning be!; please be!; you must be!
Root Family √bhū
Root √bhū･1 a (be, become)
Base √bhū + a > bhava
Construction bhava + āhi
Phonetic Change ū > av
Sanskrit bhava
Sanskrit Root √bhū 1 (be)

kaṅkhī vecikicchī āgamaṃ,
pañhe pucchituṃ abhikaṅkhamāno,
tes'antakaro bhavāhi pañhe me puṭṭho,
anupubbaṃ anudhammaṃ byākarohi me.

SNP 32 sabhiyasuttaṃ
bhavi

aor. became, existed [√bhū] ✗
bhavitabba 1

Grammar ptp of bhavati, impers
Meaning there should be; it must be; it should exist; lit. to be present
Root Family √bhū
Root √bhū･1 a (be, become)
Construction √bhū > bhav + *itabba
Derivative kicca (*itabba)
Phonetic Change ū > av
Sanskrit bhavitavya
Sanskrit Root √bhū 1 (be)

yassa siyā āpatti, so āvikareyya, asantiyā āpattiyā tuṇhī bhavitabbaṃ, tuṇhībhāvena kho pan'āyasmante parisuddhā'ti vedissāmi.

VIN PAT NID nidānuddeso

so, bhariyaṃ me nissāya bhayena uppannena bhavitabban'ti cintetvā rañño āṇaṃ paṭibāhituṃ asakkonto gantvā rājānaṃ vanditvā aṭṭhāsi

bhavitvā

abs. having existed [√bhū] ✗

cond. (+nom) would have been [√bhū] ✗

Grammar fut of bhavati, intrans (+nom)
Meaning could be; should be; lit. will be
Root Family √bhū
Root √bhū･1 a (be, become)
Base √bhū + a + issa > bhavissa (fut)
Construction bhavissa + ti
Phonetic Change ū > av
Notes Kacc 507, 501
Sanskrit bhaviṣyáti
Sanskrit Root √bhū 1 (be)

ettha ca te, māluṅkyaputta, diṭṭhasutamutaviññātabbesu dhammesu diṭṭhe diṭṭhamattaṃ bhavissati, sute sutamattaṃ bhavissati, mute mutamattaṃ bhavissati, viññāte viññātamattaṃ bhavissati.

SN 35.95 mālukyaputtasuttaṃ

tasmā't'iha te, gahapati, evaṃ sikkhitabbaṃ, āturakāyassa me sato cittaṃ anāturaṃ bhavissatī'ti. evañ'hi te, gahapati, sikkhitabban'ti.

Construction bhavissa + ti
Phonetic Change ū > av
Commentary (THIa) na puno edisakaṃ bhavissatī'ti ito paraṃ evarūpaṃ anācāracaraṇaṃ na bhavissati, na karissāmī'ti attho.
Notes Kacc 507, 501
Sanskrit bhaviṣyáti
Sanskrit Root √bhū 1 (be)

tassa ca viramāsi tāva'd'e,
rāgo tattha khamāpayī ca naṃ,
sotthi siyā brahmacārinī,
na puno edisakaṃ bhavissati.

THI 71 subhājīvakambavanikātherīgāthā
bhavissanti

sandhi. "I could be"; "I will be"; "may I be" [bhavissaṃ + iti] ✓

Grammar sandhi, cond + ind
Meaning "I could be"; "I will be"; "may I be"
Construction bhavissaṃ + iti
Commentary (ANa) bhavissan'tiādīni pana cattāri anāgatavasena vuttāni. tesam'pi purimacatukke vuttanayen'eva attho veditabbo.
Sanskrit abhaviṣyam + iti

asmī'ti, bhikkhave, maññitam'etaṃ, ayam'aham'asmī'ti maññitam'etaṃ, bhavissan'ti maññitam'etaṃ, na bhavissan'ti maññitam'etaṃ, rūpī bhavissan'ti maññitam'etaṃ

SN 35.248 yavakalāpisuttaṃ

bhavissan'ti hoti, itthaṃ bhavissan'ti hoti, evaṃ bhavissan'ti hoti, aññathā bhavissan'ti hoti. imāni aṭṭhārasa taṇhāvicaritāni ajjhattikassa upādāya.

mah'esino taṃ nu kadā bhavissati.

attā sudanto purisassa joti.

sajju khīraṃ'va muccati,
ḍahantaṃ bālam'anveti,
bhasmacchanno'va pāvako.

bhāga 1

masc. part; portion; share; measure [√bhaj + *a] ✓

Grammar masc, from bhajati
Meaning part; portion; share; measure
Root Family √bhaj
Root √bhaj･1 a (divide, distribute)
Construction √bhaj > bhag > bhāg + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change a > ā
j > g
Commentary (VIN 1.4.2.3) dve bhāgā ... dve tulā (VINa) dve bhāgā'ti dve koṭṭhāsā.
Sanskrit bhāga
Sanskrit Root √bhaj 1 (divide, share)

samānabhāgaṃ kubbetha,
gāme akkuṭṭhavanditaṃ,
manopadosaṃ rakkheyya,
santo anuṇṇato care.

SNP 37 nālakasuttaṃ
mahāvaggo 11

saṅkham'pi na upeti upanidhim'pi na upeti kalabhāgam'pi na upeti mahāpathaviṃ upanidhāya bhagavatā paritto nakhasikhāyaṃ paṃsu āropito'ti.

SN 20.2 nakhasikhasuttaṃ
bhāga 2

masc. class; category; group; subdivision [√bhaj + *a] ✓

Meaning class; category; group; subdivision
Root Family √bhaj
Root √bhaj･1 a (divide, distribute)
Construction √bhaj > bhag > bhāg + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change a > ā
j > g
Commentary (MNa) ekaṃ bhāgan'ti ... ekaṃ koṭṭhāsam'akāsiṃ.
Sanskrit bhāga
Sanskrit Root √bhaj 1 (divide, share)

so kho ahaṃ, bhikkhave, yo c'āyaṃ kāmavitakko yo ca byāpādavitakko yo ca vihiṃsāvitakko, imaṃ ekaṃ bhāgam'akāsiṃ. yo c'āyaṃ nekkhammavitakko yo ca abyāpādavitakko yo ca avihiṃsāvitakko, imaṃ dutiyaṃ bhāgam'akāsiṃ.

MN 19 dvedhāvitakkasuttaṃ

Phonetic Change a > ā
j > g
Sanskrit bhāgavat
Sanskrit Root √bhaj 1 (divide, share)

bahum'pi ce sahitaṃ bhāsamāno,
na takkaro hoti naro pamatto,
gopo'va gāvo gaṇayaṃ paresaṃ,
na bhāgavā sāmaññassa hoti.

DHP 19 yamakavaggo

appam'pi ce sahitaṃ bhāsamāno,
dhammassa hoti anudhammacārī,
rāgañ'ca dosañ'ca pahāya mohaṃ,
sammappajāno suvimuttacitto,
anupādiyāno idha vā huraṃ vā,
sa bhāgavā sāmaññassa hoti.

bhūtapubbāhaṃ, pāpima, dūsī nāma māro ahosiṃ, tassa me kāḷī nāma bhaginī. tassā tvaṃ putto. so me tvaṃ bhāgineyyo ahosi. tena kho pana, pāpima, samayena kakusandho bhagavā arahaṃ sammāsambuddho loke uppanno hoti.

MN 50 māratajjanīyasuttaṃ

rājā'pi amacce pakkosāpetvā, mayhaṃ bhāgineyyo'pi imassa rajjassa sāmiko'va, dhītaraṃ etass'eva datvā abhisekam'assa karomī'ti.

AN 10.176 cundasuttaṃ
bhātusutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 15.16 (SN15.16) ✗
bhāyati 1

pr. (+acc or +gen) is afraid (of); is frightened (of); fears; is scared (of) [√bhī + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, intrans (+acc or +gen)
Meaning is afraid (of); is frightened (of); fears; is scared (of)
Root Family √bhī
Root √bhī･1 a (fear)
Base √bhī + a > bhāya
Construction bhāya + ti
Phonetic Change ī > āy
Sanskrit bibheti
Sanskrit Root √bhī 1, 3, 10 (fear)

sabbe tasanti daṇḍassa,
sabbe bhāyanti maccuno,
attānaṃ upamaṃ katvā,
na haneyya na ghātaye.

DHP 129 daṇḍavaggo

tassa mayhaṃ, aggivessana, etadahosi, kiṃ nu kho ahaṃ tassa sukhassa bhāyāmi, yaṃ taṃ sukhaṃ aññatr'eva kāmehi aññatra akusalehi dhammehī'ti?

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ
bhāyati 2

pr. (+acc) is afraid (for); fears (for) [√bhī + a + ti] ~

Meaning is afraid (for); fears (for)

Construction bhāya + ti
Phonetic Change ī > āy

Sanskrit bibheti
Sanskrit Root √bhī 1, 3, 10 (fear)
bhāyanta

prp. fearing [√bhī] ✗
bhāyi

aor. (+acc or +gen) was afraid (of); was frightened (of); feared; was scared [√bhī + a + i] ✓

Grammar aor of bhāyati, intrans (+acc or +gen)
Meaning was afraid (of); was frightened (of); feared; was scared
Root Family √bhī
Root √bhī･1 a (fear)
Base √bhī + a > bhāya
Construction bhāya + i
Phonetic Change ī > āy
Sanskrit abhāyi, abhaiṣīt
Sanskrit Root √bhī 1, 3, 10 (fear)

mā bhāyi, mahānāma, mā bhāyi, mahānāma! apāpakaṃ te maraṇaṃ bhavissati apāpikā kālaṃkiriyā.

SN 55.21 paṭhamamahānāmasuttaṃ

mā, bhikkhave, puññānaṃ bhāyittha. sukhass'etaṃ, bhikkhave, adhivacanaṃ yadidaṃ puññāni. abhijānāmi kho pan'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, dīgharattaṃ katānaṃ puññānaṃ dīgharattaṃ iṭṭhaṃ kantaṃ manāpaṃ vipākaṃ paccanubhūtaṃ.

AN 7.62 mettasuttaṃ
bhāyitabba

Grammar ptp of bhāyati (+gen)

Construction bhāya + itabba

Sanskrit bhetavya
Sanskrit Root √bhī 1, 3, 10 (fear)

na āsevitabbaṃ, na bhāvetabbaṃ, na bahulīkātabbaṃ, bhāyitabbaṃ etassa sukhassā'ti, vadāmi.

ohito garuko bhāro,
bhavanetti samūhatā.

Sanskrit bhāvanā
Sanskrit Root √bhū 1 (be)

disvāna āyasmantaṃ rāhulaṃ āmantesi, ānāpānassatiṃ, rāhula, bhāvanaṃ bhāvehi. ānāpānassati, rāhula, bhāvanā bhāvitā bahulīkatā mahapphalā hoti mah'ānisaṃsā'ti.

MN 62 mahārāhulovādasuttaṃ

dullabhaṃ v'āpi labhanti,
cittavūpasame ratā,
yesaṃ divā ca ratto ca,
bhāvanāya rato mano'ti.

AN 10.24 mahācundasuttaṃ
bhāvanāsutta 1

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 47.39 (SN47.39) ✗
bhāvanāsutta 2

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 7.71 (AN7.71) ✗
bhāvanīya 1

Grammar adj, ptp of bhāveti, caus
Meaning respected; honoured; worthy of esteem; lit. to be developed

Root √bhū･1 *e (be, become)

Phonetic Change ū > āv
Antonym abhāvanīya
Variant bhāvaniya
Sanskrit bhāvanīya
Sanskrit Root √bhū 1 (be)

ākaṅkheyya ce, bhikkhave, bhikkhu, sabrahmacārīnaṃ piyo c'assaṃ manāpo ca garu ca bhāvanīyo cā'ti, sīlesv'ev'assa paripūrakārī ajjhattaṃ cetosamatham'anuyutto anirākatajjhāno vipassanāya samannāgato brūhetā suññ'āgārānaṃ.

AN 10.71 ākaṅkhasuttaṃ

aniccadassāvī kho pan'āhaṃ, bhante, bhagavato manobhāvanīyānañ'ca bhikkhūnaṃ.

SN 22.1 nakulapitusuttaṃ
bhāvanīya 2

adj. to be cultivated [√bhū] ✗
bhāvayati

Grammar pr, caus of bhavati, trans (+acc)
Meaning cultivates; develops; lit. causes to become
Root Family √bhū

Construction bhāvaya + ti
Phonetic Change ū > āv
Synonym bhāveti
Sanskrit bhāvayati
Sanskrit Root √bhū 1 (be)

mātā yathā niyaṃ puttaṃ,
āyusā ekaputtam'anurakkhe,
evam'pi sabbabhūtesu,
mānasaṃ bhāvaye aparimāṇaṃ.

KHP 9 karaṇīya mettasuttaṃ

tath'eva tvam'pi ahitahite,
samaṃ mettāya bhāvaya,
mettāpāramitaṃ gantvā,
sambodhiṃ pāpuṇissasī'ti.

JAa 1.N.1 sumedha kathā

asubhaṃ bhāvayate sadā sato,
esa kho byanti kāhiti,
esa checchati mārabandhanaṃ.

DHP 350 taṇhāvaggo
bhāvayanta

prp. (+acc) cultivating; developing [√bhū + *aya + nta] ✓

Grammar prp of bhāvayati, caus, trans (+acc)
Meaning cultivating; developing
Root Family √bhū
Root √bhū･1 *aya (be, become)
Base √bhū + *aya > bhāvaya (caus)
Construction bhāvaya + nta
Derivative kita (nta)
Phonetic Change ū > āv
Synonym bhāventa
Commentary (SNa) cittaṃ paññañ'ca bhāvayan'ti samādhiñ'c'eva vipassanañ'ca bhāvayamāno
Sanskrit bhāvayat
Sanskrit Root √bhū 1 (be)

sīle patiṭṭhāya naro sapañño,
cittaṃ paññañ'ca bhāvayaṃ,
ātāpī nipako bhikkhu,
so imaṃ vijaṭaye jaṭaṃ.

SN 7.6 jaṭāsuttaṃ

so taṃ maggaṃ āsevati bhāveti bahulīkaroti. tassa taṃ maggaṃ āsevato bhāvayato bahulīkaroto saṃyojanāni sabbaso pahīyanti anusayā byantīhonti.

AN 5.57 abhiṇhapaccavekkhitabbaṭhānasuttaṃ
bhāvayitvā

abs. (+acc) having cultivated; having developed; lit. having caused to become [√bhū + *aya + itvā] ✓

Grammar abs of bhāvayati, caus, trans (+acc)
Meaning having cultivated; having developed; lit. having caused to become
Root Family √bhū
Root √bhū･1 *aya (be, become)
Base √bhū + *aya > bhāvaya (caus)
Construction bhāvaya + itvā
Phonetic Change ū > āv
Synonym bhāvetvā, vibhāvetvā
Sanskrit bhāvayitvā
Sanskrit Root √bhū 1 (be)

ete dhamme bhāvayitvā,
tayo sukhasamuddaye,
abyāpajjhaṃ sukhaṃ lokaṃ,
paṇḍito upapajjatī'ti.

ITI 22 mettasuttaṃ
bhāvaye

opt. (+acc) should cultivate; should develop [√bhū + *aya + e] ✓

Grammar opt of bhāvayati, caus, trans (+acc)
Meaning should cultivate; should develop
Root Family √bhū
Root √bhū･1 *aya (be, become)
Base √bhū + *aya > bhāvaya (caus)
Construction bhāvaya + e
Phonetic Change ū > āv
Sanskrit bhū
Sanskrit Root √bhū 1 (be)

pañca chinde pañca jahe,
pañca c'uttari bhāvaye,
pañca saṅg'ātigo bhikkhu,
oghatiṇṇo'ti vuccati.

DHP 370 bhikkhuvaggo

mātā yathā niyaṃ puttaṃ,
āyusā ekaputtam'anurakkhe,
evam'pi sabbabhūtesu,
mānasaṃ bhāvaye aparimāṇaṃ.

KHP 9 karaṇīya mettasuttaṃ
bhāvita 1

pp. cultivated; developed; lit. caused to be [√bhū + *e + ita] ✓

Grammar pp of bhāveti, caus
Meaning cultivated; developed; lit. caused to be
Root Family √bhū
Root √bhū･1 *e (be, become)
Base √bhū + *e > bhāve (caus)
Construction bhāve + ita
Derivative kita (ita)
Phonetic Change ū > āv
Antonym abhāvita
Synonym vaḍḍhita
Commentary (ANa) bhāvitā'ti vaḍḍhitā.
Sanskrit bhāvita
Sanskrit Root √bhū 1 (be)

abhiññeyyaṃ abhiññātaṃ,
bhāvetabbañ'ca bhāvitaṃ,
pahātabbaṃ pahīnaṃ me,
tasmā buddho'smi brāhmaṇa.

TH 253 selattheragāthā

tasmā't'iha, bhikkhave, evaṃ sikkhitabbaṃ, kāyagatā sati no bhāvitā bhavissati bahulīkatā yānīkatā vatthukatā anuṭṭhitā paricitā susamāraddhā'ti.

Commentary (MNa) bhāvitan'ti pañcakāmaguṇā.
Sanskrit bhāvita
Sanskrit Root √bhū 1 (be)
bhāvitaiddhipāda

masc. basis for success is developed [bhāvita + iddhipāda] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning basis for success is developed
Construction bhāvita + iddhipāda
bhāvitakāya 1

adj. developed in body; physically cultivated [bhāvita + kāya] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning developed in body; physically cultivated
Construction bhāvita + kāya
Compound kammadhāraya (bhāvita + kāya)
Antonym abhāvitakāya
Sanskrit bhāvita + kāya

kāyabhāvanam'pi kho tvaṃ, aggivessana, na aññāsi, kuto pana tvaṃ cittabhāvanaṃ jānissasi? api ca, aggivessana, yathā abhāvitakāyo ca hoti abhāvitacitto ca, bhāvitakāyo ca hoti bhāvitacitto ca.

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ
bhāvitakāya 2

adj. physically restrained; lit. developed in body [bhāvita + kāya] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning physically restrained; lit. developed in body
Construction bhāvita + kāya
Compound kammadhāraya (bhāvita + kāya)
Antonym abhāvitakāya
Sanskrit bhāvita + kāya

bhāvanāvādaṃ, āvuso, bhikkhu vadamāno, bhāvitakāyo'mhi bhāvitasīlo bhāvitacitto bhāvitapañño'ti. tañ'ce, āvuso, bhikkhuṃ lobho abhibhuyya tiṭṭhati, doso abhibhuyya tiṭṭhati

AN 10.24 mahācundasuttaṃ

idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo bhāvitakāyo hoti bhāvitasīlo bhāvitacitto bhāvitapañño aparitto mahatto appamāṇavihārī.

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ
bhāvitatta 1.1

masc. who is enlightened; who is holy; who has a developed mind; who is self-developed; lit. developed self [bhāvita + atta] ✓

Grammar masc, comp, atta group
Meaning who is enlightened; who is holy; who has a developed mind; who is self-developed; lit. developed self
Construction bhāvita + atta
Compound kammadhāraya (bhāvita + atta)
Notes (MW) one whose soul is purified by meditating on the universal soul, whose thoughts are fixed on the Supreme Spirit, meditative, devout, holy, a sage, saint
Sanskrit bhāvitātman

māse māse sahassena,
yo yajetha sataṃ samaṃ,
ekañ'ca bhāvit'attānaṃ,
muhuttam'api pūjaye,
sā'y'eva pūjanā seyyo,
yañ'ce vassasataṃ hutaṃ.

DHP 106 sahassavaggo

pucchāmi taṃ bhagavā brūhi me taṃ,
maññāmi taṃ vedaguṃ bhāvit'attaṃ,
kuto nu dukkhā samudāgatā ime,
ye keci lokasmim'anekarūpā.

SNP 59 mettagū māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 4
bhāvitatta 1.2

adj. enlightened; self-developed; lit. developed self [bhāvita + atta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning enlightened; self-developed; lit. developed self
Construction bhāvita + atta
Compound kammadhāraya (bhāvita + atta)
Notes (MW) one whose soul is purified by meditating on the universal soul, whose thoughts are fixed on the Supreme Spirit, meditative, devout, holy, a sage, saint

ariyassa bhāvitattassa,
pattipattassa veyyākaraṇassa,
satimato vipassissa,
anabhinatassa no apanatassa,
anejassa vasippattassa,
bhagavato tassa sāvako'ham'asmi.

bhāvīyati

Base √bhū + *e + īya > bhāvīya (caus, pass)
Construction bhāvīya + ti
Phonetic Change ū > āv

Sanskrit bhāvyate
Sanskrit Root √bhū 1 (be)

samatho, bhikkhave, bhāvito kam'attham'anubhoti? cittaṃ bhāvīyati. cittaṃ bhāvitaṃ kam'attham'anubhoti? yo rāgo so pahīyati.

AN 2.33 bālavaggo

vipassanā, bhikkhave, bhāvitā kam'attham'anubhoti? paññā bhāvīyati. paññā bhāvitā kam'attham'anubhoti? yā avijjā sā pahīyati.

okā anokam'āgamma,
viveke yattha dūramaṃ.

DHP 87 paṇḍitavaggo

kusalaṃ, bhikkhave, bhāvetha. sakkā, bhikkhave, kusalaṃ bhāvetuṃ. no ce'daṃ, bhikkhave, sakkā abhavissa kusalaṃ bhāvetuṃ, n'āhaṃ evaṃ vadeyyaṃ, kusalaṃ, bhikkhave, bhāvethā'ti.

VISM 1.9.2 karuṇābhāvanākathā
bhāvetvā

Construction bhāve + tvā
Phonetic Change ū > āv
Synonym bhāvayitvā, vibhāvetvā
Sanskrit bhāvayitvā
Sanskrit Root √bhū 1 (be)

te pabbajitvā sugatassa sāsane,
bhāvetva bojjh'aṅgabalāni paṇḍitā,
udaggacittā sumanā kat'indriyā,
phusiṃsu nibbānapadaṃ asaṅkhatan'ti.

TH 248 adhimuttattheragāthā

evam'eva kho, bhikkhave, khattiyakulā ce'pi agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajito hoti, so ca tathāgatappaveditaṃ dhammavinayaṃ āgamma, evaṃ mettaṃ karuṇaṃ muditaṃ upekkhaṃ bhāvetvā labhati ajjhattaṃ vūpasamaṃ.

Sanskrit bhāṣat
Sanskrit Root √bhāṣ 1 (speak)

tatra, bhikkhave, taramānassa bhāsato kāyo'pi kilamati, cittam'pi upahaññati, saro'pi upahaññati, kaṇṭho'pi āturīyati, avisaṭṭham'pi hoti aviññeyyaṃ taramānassa bhāsitaṃ.

MN 139 araṇavibhaṅgasuttaṃ

yañ'hi, brāhmaṇa, diṭṭhaṃ bhāsato akusalā dhammā abhivaḍḍhanti, kusalā dhammā parihāyanti, evarūpaṃ diṭṭhaṃ na bhāsitabban'ti vadāmi.

AN 4.183 sutasuttaṃ
bhāsamāna

prp. (+acc) speaking (about); talking (about); saying [√bhās + a + māna] ✓

Grammar prp of bhāsati, trans (+acc)
Meaning speaking (about); talking (about); saying
Root Family √bhās
Root √bhās･1 a (speak)
Base √bhās + a > bhāsa
Construction bhāsa + māna
Derivative kita (māna)
Antonym abhāsamāna
Sanskrit bhāṣamāṇa
Sanskrit Root √bhāṣ 1 (speak)

bahum'pi ce sahitaṃ bhāsamāno,
na takkaro hoti naro pamatto,
gopo'va gāvo gaṇayaṃ paresaṃ,
na bhāgavā sāmaññassa hoti.

DHP 19 yamakavaggo

n'ābhāsamānaṃ jānanti,
missaṃ bālehi paṇḍitaṃ,
bhāsamānañ'ca jānanti,
desentaṃ amataṃ padaṃ.

AN 4.48 visākhasuttaṃ

paggaṇhe isinaṃ dhajaṃ,
subhāsitadhajā isayo,
dhammo hi isinaṃ dhajo'ti.

dhammaṃ paṇītaṃ manujesu brahme'ti.

na tena bhikkhako hoti,
yāvatā bhikkhate pare,
vissaṃ dhammaṃ samādāya,
bhikkhu hoti na tāvatā.

SN 7.20 bhikkhakasuttaṃ

bhikkhū'ti bhikkhako'ti bhikkhu, bhikkh'ācariyaṃ ajjhupagato'ti bhikkhu, bhinnapaṭadharo'ti bhikkhu, samaññāya bhikkhu, paṭiññāya bhikkhu, ehi bhikkhū'ti bhikkhu, tīhi saraṇagamanehi upasampanno'ti bhikkhu

par'āgāresu bhikkhati.

mā taṃ kālo upaccagā'ti.

mahāvaggo 11

te upakaṭṭhāya vass'ūpanāyikāya pañcasatatāpase himavantato āgantvā nagare bhikkhāya carante disvā pasīditvā nisīdāpetvā bhojetvā paṭiññaṃ gahetvā cattāro māse attano santike vasāpetvā puna vass'āratte āgaman'atthāya paṭijānāpetvā uyyojesuṃ.

SNP 37 nālakasuttaṃ
mahāvaggo 11

bhikkhū'ti bhikkhako'ti bhikkhu, bhikkhācariyaṃ ajjhupagato'ti bhikkhu, bhinnapaṭadharo'ti bhikkhu, samaññāya bhikkhu, paṭiññāya bhikkhu, ehi bhikkhū'ti bhikkhu, tīhi saraṇagamanehi upasampanno'ti bhikkhu

VIN 1.1.1 paṭhamapārājikaṃ, santhatabhāṇavāro
bhikkhi

aor. begged alms, asked for [√bhikkh] ✗
bhikkhikā

fem. female beggar; mendicant [√bhikkh + ikā] ~

Grammar fem, agent, from bhikkhati
Meaning female beggar; mendicant
Root Family √bhikkh
Root √bhikkh･1 a (beg)
Construction √bhikkh + ikā
Derivative kita (ikā)
Sanskrit bhikṣukī
Sanskrit Root √bhikṣ 1 (beg)
bhikkhu

masc. monk; monastic; mendicant; fully ordained monk; lit. beggar [√bhikkh + u] ✓

Grammar masc, from bhikkhati
Meaning monk; monastic; mendicant; fully ordained monk; lit. beggar
Root Family √bhikkh
Root √bhikkh･1 a (beg)
Construction √bhikkh + u
Derivative kita (u)
Sanskrit bhikṣu
Sanskrit Root √bhikṣ 1 (beg)

kāmesu n'ābhigijjheyya,
manas'ānāvilo siyā,
kusalo sabbadhammānaṃ,
sato bhikkhu paribbaje'ti.

SNP 56 ajita māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 1

idam'avoca bhagavā. attamanā te bhikkhū bhagavato bhāsitaṃ abhinandun'ti.

MN 40 cūḷāssapurasuttaṃ
bhikkhuakkosanasikkhāpada

nt. rule about abusing monks [bhikkhu + akkosana + sikkhāpada] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning rule about abusing monks
Construction bhikkhu + akkosana + sikkhāpada
bhikkhuaparihāniyadhamma

masc. principle of non-decline for a monk ✗
bhikkhuovādaka

adj. advising the monks; instructing the mendicants [bhikkhu + ovādaka] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning advising the monks; instructing the mendicants
Construction bhikkhu + ovādaka
Commentary (ANa) bhikkhuovādakānan'ti bhikkhū ovadantānaṃ mahākappinatthero aggo'ti dasseti. ayaṃ kira thero ekasamodhānasmiṃ'y'eva dhammakathaṃ kathento bhikkhusahassaṃ arahattaṃ pāpesi. tasmā bhikkhuovādakānaṃ aggo nāma jāto.
bhikkhuka

adj. about a monk; regarding a mendicant; lit. about a beggar [√bhikkh + u + ka] ~

Grammar adj, from bhikkhu
Meaning about a monk; regarding a mendicant; lit. about a beggar
Root Family √bhikkh
Root √bhikkh･1 a (beg)
Construction √bhikkh + u + ka
bhikkhu + ka
Derivative taddhita (kaa)
Sanskrit bhikṣuka
Sanskrit Root √bhikṣ 1 (beg)
bhikkhugaṇa

masc. group of monks; crowd of mendicants [bhikkhu + gaṇa] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning group of monks; crowd of mendicants
Construction bhikkhu + gaṇa
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (bhikkhūnaṃ + gaṇa)
Sanskrit bhikṣu + gaṇa

so ārāmaṃ gantvā bhikkhugaṇassa majjhe vikatthati, bhuttāvī c'amhi yāva'd'attho, nimantito c'amhi svātanāya, piṇḍapāto ca my'āyaṃ pūro, lābhī c'amhi cīvara-piṇḍapāta-sen'āsana-gilānappaccaya-bhesajjaparikkhārānaṃ

SN 12.67 naḷakalāpīsuttaṃ
bhikkhudassana

nt. seeing the monks; meeting the monastics [bhikkhu + dassana] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning seeing the monks; meeting the monastics
Construction bhikkhu + dassana
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (bhikkhū + dassana)
Commentary (ANa) bhikkhudassanaṃ hāpetī'ti bhikkhusaṅghassa dassan'atthāya gamanaṃ hāpeti.
Sanskrit bhikṣu + darśana

bhikkhudassanaṃ hāpeti, saddhammassavanaṃ pamajjati, adhisīle na sikkhati, appasādabahulo hoti, bhikkhūsu theresu c'eva navesu ca majjhimesu ca upārambhacitto dhammaṃ suṇāti randhagavesī, ito bahiddhā dakkhiṇeyyaṃ gavesati, tattha ca pubbakāraṃ karoti. ime kho, bhikkhave, satta dhammā upāsakassa parihānāya saṃvattanti.

AN 7.29 dutiyaparihānisuttaṃ
bhikkhunaṃ

masc. monk (object) [√bhikkh + u + unaṃ] ✓

Grammar masc, acc sg of bhikkhu
Meaning monk (object)
Root Family √bhikkh
Root √bhikkh･1 a (beg)
Construction √bhikkh + u + unaṃ
bhikkhu + unaṃ
Sanskrit bhikṣu
Sanskrit Root √bhikṣ 1 (beg)

kiṃ pattinam'āhu bhikkhunaṃ,
sorataṃ kena kathañ'ca dantam'āhu.
buddho'ti kathaṃ pavuccati,
puṭṭho me bhagavā byākarohi.

SNP 32 sabhiyasuttaṃ
bhikkhunā

masc. by a monk [√bhikkh + u + unā] ✓

Grammar masc, instr sg of bhikkhu
Meaning by a monk
Root Family √bhikkh
Root √bhikkh･1 a (beg)
Construction √bhikkh + u + unā
bhikkhu + unā
Sanskrit bhikṣuṇā
Sanskrit Root √bhikṣ 1 (beg)

tena, bhikkhave, bhikkhunā tesaṃ'y'eva pāpakānaṃ akusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ pahānāya adhimatto chando ca vāyāmo ca ussāho ca ussoḷhī ca appaṭivānī ca sati ca sampajaññañ'ca karaṇīyaṃ.

AN 10.51 sacittasuttaṃ

cha, bhikkhave, ānisaṃse sampassamānena alam'eva bhikkhunā sabbasaṅkhāresu anodhiṃ karitvā aniccasaññaṃ upaṭṭhāpetuṃ. katame cha?

AN 6.102 anavatthitasuttaṃ
bhikkhuniummaddāpanasikkhāpada

nt. rule about making nuns give massages [bhikkhunī + ummaddāpana + sikkhāpada] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning rule about making nuns give massages
Construction bhikkhunī + ummaddāpana + sikkhāpada
bhikkhunidūsaka

masc. who has raped a nun [bhikkhunī + dūsaka] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning who has raped a nun
Construction bhikkhunī + dūsaka
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (bhikkhuniyā + dūsaka)
Commentary (VINa) bhikkhunidūsako bhikkhave'ti ettha yo pakatattaṃ bhikkhuniṃ tiṇṇaṃ maggānaṃ aññatarasmiṃ dūseti, ayaṃ bhikkhunidūsako nāma. etassa pabbajjā ca upasampadā ca vāritā. yo pana kāyasaṃsaggena sīlavināsaṃ pāpeti, tassa pabbajjā ca upasampadā ca na vāritā. balakkārena odātavatthavasanaṃ katvā anicchamānaṃ'y'eva dūsento'pi bhikkhunidūsako'y'eva.
Sanskrit bhiksuṇī + dūṣaka

paṇḍako tassaṃ parisāyaṃ nisinno hoti, paṇḍakakathā vippakatā hoti, bhikkhunidūsako tassaṃ parisāyaṃ nisinno hoti, bhikkhunidūsakakathā vippakatā hoti, ime kho, upāli, dasa pātimokkhaṭṭhapanā'ti.

AN 10.32 pātimokkhaṭṭhapanāsuttaṃ
bhikkhunidūsakakathā

fem. discussion about (whether or not a person is) a nun rapist [bhikkhunidūsaka + kathā] ✓

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning discussion about (whether or not a person is) a nun rapist
Construction bhikkhunidūsaka + kathā
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (bhikkhunidūsakassa + kathā)
Sanskrit bhiksuṇī + dūṣaka + kathā

paṇḍako tassaṃ parisāyaṃ nisinno hoti, paṇḍakakathā vippakatā hoti, bhikkhunidūsako tassaṃ parisāyaṃ nisinno hoti, bhikkhunidūsakakathā vippakatā hoti, ime kho, upāli, dasa pātimokkhaṭṭhapanā'ti.

AN 10.32 pātimokkhaṭṭhapanāsuttaṃ
bhikkhuniparipācita

adj. organized by a nun; arranged by a nun; lit. brought to fruition by a nun [bhikkhunī + paripācita] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning organized by a nun; arranged by a nun; lit. brought to fruition by a nun
Construction bhikkhunī + paripācita
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (bhikkhuniyā + paripācita)
Commentary (VINa) bhikkhuniparipācitan'ti bhikkhuniyā paripācitaṃ, guṇappakāsanena nipphāditaṃ, laddhabbaṃ katan'ti attho.
Sanskrit bhiksuṇī + paripācita

yo pana bhikkhu jānaṃ bhikkhuniparipācitaṃ piṇḍapātaṃ bhuñjeyya aññatra pubbe gihisamārambhā, pācittiyaṃ.

bhikkhunī

fem. nun; fully ordained nun [√bhikkh + u + nī] ✓

Grammar fem, from bhikkhu
Meaning nun; fully ordained nun
Root Family √bhikkh
Root √bhikkh･1 a (beg)
Construction √bhikkh + u + nī
bhikkhu + nī
Derivative taddhita (nī)
Variant bhikkhuṇī
Commentary (VIN 1.4.1.4) bhikkhunī nāma ubhatosaṅghe upasampannā.
Sanskrit bhiksuṇī
Sanskrit Root √bhikṣ 1 (beg)

yo kho, ānanda, bhikkhu vā bhikkhunī vā upāsako vā upāsikā vā dhamm'ānudhammappaṭipanno viharati sāmīcippaṭipanno anudhammacārī so tathāgataṃ sakkaroti garuṃ karoti māneti pūjeti apaciyati paramāya pūjāya

DN 16.27 mahāparinibbānasuttaṃ

na tāv'āhaṃ, pāpima, parinibbāyissāmi, yāva me bhikkhuniyo na sāvikā bhavissanti viyattā vinītā visāradā bahussutā dhammadharā dhamm'ānudhammappaṭipannā

bhikkhunupassaya

masc. nun’s dwelling; nun’s lodging [bhikkhunī + upassaya] ✓

Sanskrit bhiksuṇī + upāśraya

yo pana bhikkhu bhikkhun'upassayaṃ upasaṅkamitvā bhikkhuniyo ovadeyya aññatra samayā, pācittiyaṃ. tatth'āyaṃ samayo, gilānā hoti bhikkhunī, ayaṃ tattha samayo.

VIN PAT PC 23 bhikkhunupassayasikkhāpadaṃ

atha kho āyasmā ānando pubb'aṇhasamayaṃ nivāsetvā pattacīvaram'ādāya yena aññataro bhikkhun'upassayo ten'upasaṅkami

bhikkhuno 1

masc. for monk; to monk [√bhikkh + u + uno] ✓

Grammar masc, dat sg of bhikkhu
Meaning for monk; to monk
Root Family √bhikkh
Root √bhikkh･1 a (beg)
Construction √bhikkh + u + uno
bhikkhu + uno
Sanskrit bhikṣuṇe
Sanskrit Root √bhikṣ 1 (beg)

evam'evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno paccavekkhaṇā bahukārā hoti kusalesu dhammesu

AN 10.51 sacittasuttaṃ

yassa kassaci, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno abhijjhālussa abhijjhā appahīnā hoti, byāpannacittassa byāpādo appahīno hoti, kodhanassa kodho appahīno hoti

MN 40 cūḷāssapurasuttaṃ
bhikkhuno 2

masc. of monk; monk's [√bhikkh + u + uno] ✓

Grammar masc, gen sg of bhikkhu
Meaning of monk; monk's
Root Family √bhikkh
Root √bhikkh･1 a (beg)
Construction √bhikkh + u + uno
bhikkhu + uno
Variant bhikkhussa
Sanskrit bhikṣuṇaḥ
Sanskrit Root √bhikṣ 1 (beg)

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, matajaṃ nāma āvudhajātaṃ ubhatodhāraṃ pītanisitaṃ. tadassa saṅghāṭiyā sampārutaṃ sampaliveṭhitaṃ. tath'ūpam'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, imassa bhikkhuno pabbajjaṃ vadāmi.

MN 40 cūḷāssapurasuttaṃ

atha kho aññataro bhikkhu yen'aññataro bhikkhu ten'upasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā taṃ bhikkhuṃ etadavoca, kittāvatā nu kho, āvuso, bhikkhuno dassanaṃ suvisuddhaṃ hotī'ti?

SN 35.245 kiṃsukopamasuttaṃ
bhikkhuno 3

masc. when a monk [√bhikkh + u + uno] ✓

Grammar masc, gen sg of bhikkhu, gen abs
Meaning when a monk
Root Family √bhikkh
Root √bhikkh･1 a (beg)
Construction √bhikkh + u + uno
bhikkhu + uno
Sanskrit bhikṣuṇaḥ
Sanskrit Root √bhikṣ 1 (beg)

evam'eva kho, bhikkhave, bhāvan'ānuyogaṃ anuyuttassa bhikkhuno viharato kiñ'c'āpi na evaṃ ñāṇaṃ hoti, ettakaṃ vata me ajja āsavānaṃ khīṇaṃ, ettakaṃ hiyyo, ettakaṃ pare'ti, atha khv'assa khīṇe khīṇan'tv'eva ñāṇaṃ hoti.

SN 22.101 vāsijaṭasuttaṃ

patilīnacarassa bhikkhuno,
bhajamānassa vivittam'āsanaṃ,
sāmaggiyam'āhu tassa taṃ,
yo attānaṃ bhavane na dassaye.

SNP 44 jarāsuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 6
bhikkhunoāyuvaṇṇādivaḍḍhanakathā

fem. discussion about increasing the life-span and beauty of a monk [bhikkhuno + āyu + vaṇṇa + ādi + vaḍḍhana + kathā] ~

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning discussion about increasing the life-span and beauty of a monk
Construction bhikkhuno + āyu + vaṇṇa + ādi + vaḍḍhana + kathā
bhikkhunovādaka

masc. instructor of the nuns; exhorter of nuns [bhikkhunī + ovādaka] ✓

Grammar masc, agent, comp
Meaning instructor of the nuns; exhorter of nuns
Construction bhikkhunī + ovādaka
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (bhikkhunīnaṃ + ovādaka)
Sanskrit bhiksuṇī + avavādaka

evaṃ vadeyyā'ti upasampannaṃ saṅghena sammataṃ bhikkhun'ovādakaṃ avaṇṇaṃ kattu'kāmo ayasaṃ kattu'kāmo maṅkukattu'kāmo evaṃ vadeti

VIN 2.5.3.4 āmisasikkhāpadaṃ
bhikkhunovādakasammuti

fem. designation as instructor of the nuns; appointment as exhorter of nuns [bhikkhunovādaka + sammuti] ✓

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning designation as instructor of the nuns; appointment as exhorter of nuns
Construction bhikkhunovādaka + sammuti
Sanskrit bhiksuṇī + avavādaka + sammati

tassapāpiyasikakammakatena, bhikkhave, bhikkhunā aṭṭhasu dhammesu sammā vattitabbaṃ, na upasampādetabbo, na nissayo dātabbo, na sāmaṇero upaṭṭhāpetabbo, na bhikkhun'ovādakasammuti sāditabbā, sammaten'api bhikkhuniyo na ovaditabbā, na kāci saṅghasammuti sāditabbā, na kismiñci paccekaṭṭhāne ṭhapetabbo, na ca tena mūlena vuṭṭhāpetabbo.

AN 8.90 sammāvattanasuttaṃ
bhikkhupaccatthika

masc. enemy monk; hostile monastic [bhikkhu + paccatthika] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning enemy monk; hostile monastic
Construction bhikkhu + paccatthika
Commentary (VINa) tattha paṭipakkhaṃ atthayanti icchantī'ti paccatthikā, bhikkhū eva paccatthikā bhikkhupaccatthikā, visabhāgānaṃ veribhikkhūnam'etaṃ adhivacanaṃ.
bhikkhuparisā

fem. assembly of monks; gathering of monastics [bhikkhu + parisā] ✓

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning assembly of monks; gathering of monastics
Construction bhikkhu + parisā
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (bhikkhūnaṃ + parisā)
Sanskrit bhikṣu + pariṣad

tena bhikkhunā so patto bhikkhuparisāya nissajjitabbo, yo ca tassā bhikkhuparisāya pattapariyanto, so tassa bhikkhuno padātabbo, ayaṃ te bhikkhu patto yāva bhedanāya dhāretabbo'ti, ayaṃ tattha sāmīci.

bhikkhupeyyāla

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning elided repetition series on monks

Grammar nt, abstr, comp

Sanskrit bhikṣu + paiśunya

bhikkhupesuññe pācittiyaṃ.

VIN PAT PC 3 pesuññasikkhāpadaṃ
bhikkhubhāva

masc. monkhood; lit. monk state [bhikkhu + bhāva] ✓

Grammar masc, abstr, comp
Meaning monkhood; lit. monk state
Construction bhikkhu + bhāva
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (bhikkhussa + bhāva)
Sanskrit bhikṣubhāva

catunnaṃ māsānaṃ accayena āraddhacittā bhikkhū pabbājenti, upasampādenti bhikkhubhāvāya. api ca m'ettha puggalavemattatā viditā'ti.

SNP 32 sabhiyasuttaṃ

app'eva nāma naṃ imamhā brahmacariyā cāveyyan'ti bhikkhubhāvā cāveyyaṃ, samaṇadhammā cāveyyaṃ, sīlakkhandhā cāveyyaṃ, tapoguṇā cāveyyaṃ.

VIN 1.2.8 duṭṭhadosasikkhāpadaṃ
bhikkhubhikkhuniyo

fem. monks and nuns [bhikkhu + bhikkhunī + iyo] ~

Grammar fem pl, comp
Meaning monks and nuns
Construction bhikkhu + bhikkhunī + iyo
bhikkhubhikkhunī + iyo
bhikkhumajjhagata

adj. among the monks; gone amidst monastics [bhikkhu + majjhagata] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning among the monks; gone amidst monastics
Construction bhikkhu + majjhagata
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (bhikkhūnaṃ + majjhagata)
Sanskrit bhikṣu + madhyagata

gacchanto'pi sukhaṃ sātaṃ n'ādhigacchati, ṭhito'pi … nisinno'pi … sayāno'pi … gāmagato'pi … araññagato'pi … rukkhamūlagato'pi … suññ'āgāragato'pi … abbhokāsagato'pi … bhikkhumajjhagato'pi sukhaṃ sātaṃ n'ādhigacchati. anabhiratiyā, āvuso, sati idaṃ dukkhaṃ pāṭikaṅkhaṃ.

AN 10.66 dutiyasukhasuttaṃ
bhikkhumānatta

nt. paying respect to monks; deference to the monks [bhikkhu + mānatta] ✓

Grammar nt, abstr, comp
Meaning paying respect to monks; deference to the monks
Construction bhikkhu + mānatta
Compound catutthī tappurisa (bhikkhūnaṃ + mānatta)
Commentary (VINa) bhikkhumānattāyā'ti bhikkhūnaṃ mānanabhāvāya, ārādhanatthāyā'ti vuttaṃ hoti.
Sanskrit bhikṣu + mānatva

parivutthaparivāsena bhikkhunā uttari chārattaṃ bhikkhumānattāya paṭipajjitabbaṃ, ciṇṇamānatto bhikkhu yattha siyā vīsatigaṇo bhikkhusaṅgho, tattha so bhikkhu abbhetabbo.

VIN PAT SA saṅghādisesuddeso
bhikkhumāsajja

Grammar ger, comp vb
Meaning attacking a monk; assaulting a monastic
Construction bhikkhuṃ + āsajja

bhikkhusaṅgha

masc. community of monks; monastic order [bhikkhu + saṅgha] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning community of monks; monastic order
Construction bhikkhu + saṅgha
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (bhikkhūnaṃ + saṅgha)
Variant bhikkhusaṃgha
Sanskrit bhikṣusaṃgha

evam'evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, idh'ekacco bhikkhu bhikkhusaṅghaṃ piṭṭhito piṭṭhito anubandho hoti, aham'pi bhikkhu, aham'pi bhikkhū'ti.

AN 3.83 gadrabhasuttaṃ

es'āhaṃ bhavantaṃ gotamaṃ saraṇaṃ gacchāmi dhammañ'ca bhikkhusaṅghañ'ca, labheyyāhaṃ bhoto gotamassa santike pabbajjaṃ, labheyyaṃ upasampadan'ti.

SNP 4 kasibhāradvājasuttaṃ
uragavaggo 4
bhikkhusaṅghaparivuta

adj. surrounded by a community of monks; encircled by the monastic order [bhikkhu + saṅgha + parivuta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning surrounded by a community of monks; encircled by the monastic order
Construction bhikkhu + saṅgha + parivuta
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (bhikkhusaṅghena + parivuta)
Sanskrit bhikṣusaṃgha + parivṛtta

tena kho pana samayena bhagavā tadah'uposathe pannarase puṇṇāya puṇṇamāya rattiyā bhikkhusaṅghaparivuto abbhokāse nisinno hoti.

SNP 38 dvayatānupassanāsuttaṃ

ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā vajjīsu viharati ukkacelāyaṃ gaṅgāya nadiyā tīre mahatā bhikkhusaṅghena saddhiṃ aciraparinibbutesu sāriputtamoggallānesu. tena kho pana samayena bhagavā bhikkhusaṅghaparivuto ajjhokāse nisinno hoti.

SN 47.14 ukkacelasuttaṃ
bhikkhusaṅghapurakkhata

Construction bhikkhusaṅgha + purakkhata
Commentary (APAa) bhikkhusaṅghapurakkhato bhikkhusaṅghena parivuto.

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning one hundred monks
Construction bhikkhu + sata
Compound kammadhāraya (bhikkhu + sata)
Sanskrit bhikṣu + śata

evaṃ me sutaṃ, ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā videhesu cārikaṃ carati mahatā bhikkhusaṅghena saddhiṃ pañcamattehi bhikkhusatehi.

MN 91 brahmāyusuttaṃ

tena kho pana samayena āyasmā mahākassapo pāvāya kusināraṃ addhānamaggappaṭippanno hoti mahatā bhikkhusaṅghena saddhiṃ pañcamattehi bhikkhusatehi

bhikkhusammuti

fem. permission from the monks; consent of the monks [bhikkhu + sammuti] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning permission from the monks; consent of the monks
Construction bhikkhu + sammuti

Sanskrit bhikṣu + sammati

VIN PAT NP 2 udositasikkhāpadaṃ

orena ce channaṃ vassānaṃ taṃ santhataṃ vissajjetvā vā avissajjetvā vā aññaṃ navaṃ santhataṃ kārāpeyya aññatra bhikkhusammutiyā, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.

Construction bhijja + ti
Phonetic Change dy > jj
Sanskrit bhidyate
Sanskrit Root √bhid 1, 7 (split)

ukkaṇṭhāmi sarīrena,
bhaven'amhi anatthiko,
so'yaṃ bhijjissati kāyo,
añño ca na bhavissati.

TH 248 adhimuttattheragāthā

parijiṇṇam'idaṃ rūpaṃ,
roganīḷaṃ pabhaṅguraṃ,
bhijjati pūtisandeho,
maraṇ'antañ'hi jīvitaṃ.

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, rajako vā cittakārako vā rajanāya vā lākhāya vā haliddiyā vā nīliyā vā mañjiṭṭhāya vā suparimaṭṭhe phalake vā bhittiyā vā dussapaṭṭe vā itthirūpaṃ vā purisarūpaṃ vā abhinimmineyya sabb'aṅgapacc'aṅgiṃ.

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, kūṭ'āgāre vā kūṭ'āgārasālāyaṃ vā pācīnavātapānā sūriye uggacchante vātapānena rasmi pavisitvā kv'āssa patiṭṭhitā'ti? pacchimāyaṃ, bhante, bhittiyan'ti.

kappaṭṭho saṅghabhedako,
vaggarato adhammaṭṭho,
yogakkhemā padhaṃsati,
saṅghaṃ samaggaṃ bhitvāna,
kappaṃ nirayamhi paccatī'ti.
